Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mr and Mrs. Smith

Gm3U_whfbsBkT4qC1YVlwA.text: One of the BEST bars in Vegas hands down! Forget the clubs and come here! I first came to Carnival bar in July 2007 and have been coming back every time ever since. They have a huge dance floor with live music and the band's that play are always awesome! Then after the band is done a DJ comes on stage and spins all night.   The bartenders do amazing bar tricks that are sure to impress. They have so much open space where you don't feel crammed or pushed around. You can even do bottle service for a very reasonable price where you have your own section and table. They have hot girls dancing up above you and you can gamble there too. So much entertainment in one spot!  Always a fun crowd and great music to dance to. This place is great for groups as you will have no problem getting in. There is a small cover charge but it's definitely worth it! Love it here!!

iX1CskaesqsdkkTCFW9w-Q.text: This place is the best on the strip! Great atmosphere, it's outdoors, great band. Bartenders are the amazing. Adam goes above and beyond when it comes to making drinks and interacting with guests. This is the only place we'll come to on the strip!! Thank you Adam for a great night!!

eEZIrmy4ssgQaab49MtXzQ.text: Excellent venue for entertainment, place to dance, large bar, and of course table games to gamble. Get your cameras out (yeah right who has one of those any more? grab your phone) It is indeed a carnival bar as the bartenders can do some awesome tricks.

QGGs9-gl1sxayH-mYpCf5w.text: Kinda lame...we went on a Friday night and it wasn't that hoppin and the music was just ok...skip

UPjvCxdCWLRHylfFcZsZeg.text: The band tonight sucks. Your harmonies are weak and do not complement the original band. I might as well listen to karaoke.

pTmfgIziLDYtHcNuzu3HLg.text: I absolutely love Carnival Court. Here's why::   They have great entertainment, poker and blackjack tables, girls dancing high above the crowd on the exteriors in cages, live music and a dance floor, and bartenders who do tricks, play games, and pass out free shots!! Mig is an amazing bartender....I come to see him whenever I am in Vegas. They pile things high on their heads, out their mouths, add fire, ice, glass etc and walk around the entire circular bar. They are always throwing around bottles and spinning around doing fancy things.   Drinks are affordable, entertainment is great, and I love the outside and open concept. You do have to use the bathroom in Harrah's which is next door. That kind of blows.   Definetly go to Carnival Court when you're in Vegas: you will love the laid back feel and you will not be bored!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My brother getting a free shot
Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mig the Great

wyWhbIGSOVasbUjoZcWlSw.text: Adam, Ruggs, Vache, Rene, and Steve are amazing and personable bartenders. They made my time here so much fun and were entertaining.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AHw5-uzfv39ctPCYcZnaCg.text: Love the live music the atmosphere and no cover makes this one of the best places to just hangout.

JApyPZUrkotCfidRdooJBA.text: Really cool place to hang out, cool bartender and they give you free shoot every now and then as long as you are staying on the bar.  No outside drink allow.  Mr. & Mrs Smith band rock on :)

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jager shot
Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mai tai &amp; red bull vodka
Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Midori sour

h5V1lpoBOEJv5wWT5DHQAg.text: A great experience!  They always have good live music and the flair bartenders are awesome!  I go to Vegas with a group of friends once a year and it has been our ritual since 2010 to spend our 1st night at Carnival Court!  We often make and 2nd and even 3rd stop before the week is over.

ezhhZqhmIQFHUNPbuyoUQw.text: Cool outdoor bar with a few gambling tables and a stage with free live music throughout the day. We had a good time listening to the band. The band played and sang very well, but their schtick I could have done without. When you play well you don't need a hook. The location is cool, I like the tent-like feel of being outside but protected from the elements. We were there in the late afternoon and the sun was shining right into the bar seating area, which was a bit annoying, but what can you do about the sun when you're outside? The bartenders were practicing the "Cocktail"-esque bottle flipping when we were there with fake bottles. I'm sure at night their theatrics are very cool. The place is plenty big and it was a good blend of music, bar scene, dance club, and gambling spot to keep any kind of Vegas visitor occupied. Cool spot to go if your party can't agree on what to do at night.

4ZpGnGRF2Q6h7jjUWHkNhA.text: 5 Stars for the Bartenders. They are absolutely hilarious and entertaining. They do awesome bar tricks and poke fun at each other and the patrons. 5 Stars for the female singer of Mr. & Mrs. Smith. Mr. Smith is worth the eye candy but he is pretty bad. 3 Stars for the DJ who has 3 songs: Don't Stop Believing, Shots by LMFAO, and I'm sexy and I know it. These songs are played every 30 minutes. Overall it was an amazing time- mostly due to the awesome bartenders! I wouldn't normally come here because it looks kind of seedy, but I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink and a Vegas Bomb
Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zEg8TZwlPup3pQqdFNpGsg.text: Pretty amazing bartenders. Expect entertainment when getting drinks prepared. Music all day long. Dj playing some good tunes. I'm ready to dance the night away.

BUSRuw8B6wrT5Q2uNwsc4Q.text: It was my last night on the strip, and I was really excited to go here. Security Guard was disrespectful, rude, and seemed like he hated his job. Walked in to the bar and was stopped rudely asking for my Id showed him my Id, and he said we are over capacity. The rude service is what I dislike. Took myself to the next bar with music.

HKOj7UdKMsxmVQ5Xwe7qFw.text: My new favorite IT place in Vegas.  I saw this on Food Network that they had flair bartenders, so I HAD to check it out. I can't believe I always walked by it and never knew.  Sandwiched in between Harrah's and Imperial Palace, Carnival Court is a chill outdoor bar to go to, when you're tired of all that so-called Vegas glamour and glitz. No need to wear a dress, no need to stumble in heels, no need to wait in line, no stupid cover (although I'm a girl...I never pay cover anyways :P).  This place sure does draw in an interesting crowd, from the young college kids to the older folks. But I have to admit there were many down to earth people, including the bartenders. It was nice change of pace conversing with people instead of booty grinding.   But if you wanna dance, they got a dance floor too! So you can dance off all that alcohol. They had a DJ when I was there, but I hear they have live cover bands earlier in the day.  Prices here are comparable to the clubs...$10-12, but they are surprisingly strong. I got more messed up here from 3 drinks (Mai Tai, White Russian, Crown & Coke) than I did the previous night at Club Pure, which I had a Jaegerbomb and FOUR AMF's (total fail). And you get fancy flair! Good drinks and a show...bonus points in my book.  I have yet to try their food, although I'd prolly throw it all up anyways.  Everyone's here to have a good time, and no one's trying to impress anyone. It's loud, rowdy, and maybe a little dirty. My kinda place! ;)

Qh9i5uwE-U9QN2hunoCKYA.text: Didn't go into the bar just ordered outside at the drink booth. Huge drink- half a yard, i believe, around $36. Bar tender knew some cool tricks, was very friendly. Plus you get a cool take home enormous cup. I'd order one again ;)

i-RS4AdpTgQwv6ealllxpg.text: I am a normal guy, I like to wear shorts and flip flops. My wife is a normal girl, she like to dress up and wear flip flops.   We had a blast here, the drinks are stiff, the service is slow and the freaks are abundant.   Let me back up a little.   Drinks are stiff. They forgot the coke on several of my orders and splashed a drop to get a little color.   Service is slow. Because they are amazing entertainers. Flippy and Steve are great together. Get there early and watch the show.   Freaks. Granted it IS Vegas but man o man. We saw a toothless chick crying over her daughters 18th b-day, a lesbian chick with too much eye makeup on her way to Bon Jovi, a muscle bound dude drink 3/4 bottle of Jaigermiester. nasty Several girls offering their boobs as money holders for the guys to grab with their teeth. Whipped Cream dicks, pussy's and cherry bombs. WOW Great time for all...   As for Pris Sarah Jane's comments.. I guess she was right?  (alcoholic trailer-park-dwelling assembly-line-worker-on-vacati on-from-Rustbucket, USA),

LmN6j2fnIC5AzEK4mrE0Rg.text: YES! Probably the best free in to do in Las Vegas! My friends and I heard the music coming from outside and wanted it check it out, so glad we did. Walked into a circular bar with a huge stage and dance floor. The bartenders are awesome and do so many tricks and keep you really entertained while they make your drinks. It was pretty packed but we got drinks rather quickly. My friend did their "BJ drink" for $25 which we both thought was really pricey but wanted the experience. I only took videos but the drink is pretty hilarious and the bartender plays along while she was drinking. The funniest thing ever if you're into stuff like that! The DJ was legit and played a bunch of rap that we danced to alllll night. They have a spacious dance floor so you can actually dance and not feel like a sardine. They also had a band that night named, Mr. And Mrs. Smith who covered pop songs and they were legit. Very entertaining and kept the partying going. Overall this was a great night for free entry and affordable drinks. I will be coming back here next trip.

Wtqbx8mEv_rxDaZcwwfahw.text: Highly recommend everyone visits the Carnaval Court at least once in any of their Vegas trips! I had so much fun here and yeah the people there can get a little weird/drunk/annoying but as long as you and your group are having a good time you usually don't notice the bad apples. Each time I went was during the day so didn't have to worry about a cover. Also, the bathroom is indeed inside Harrah's but never had a problem walking to them, the walk isn't too bad. I rather walk than have to wait in a long line which I never encountered.   The band was HILARIOUS and constantly had me laughing with their silly contests, noises, dancing, etc. The flare bartenders are great and make really good drinks. I never once complained about a drink that they served me. It's so fun watching them do their thing and screaming for them and the free shots?? The shots don't taste the greatest and I'm convinced there really isn't very much alcohol in them and found them to leave my face and hands sticky but the fun is in taking the shots. Nothing like giving the bartender a $1 or more and having them pour it directly into your mouth while everyone around you cheers. Good times!  Carnaval Court is my new favorite place to drink during the day. Go early in the afternoon and get a table at the bar. So much more fun than standing on the outside. Trust me.

lbCZ6QgbhuA36fNYqq8t8w.text: OMG! This is the best bar in the world! I love this place. Most bar tenders are fun, happy, and friendly... You are guaranteed to have a great time and laugh a LOT! Its just your average joe having a good time. I love how casual it feels. The music is always great. Love the "free" shots!!

keHYMEcvjSr68ujnmDP7Iw.text: Great outdoor location, short line, live music alternating with DJs playing party/dance music. Mixed fun crowd. One of my favs in Vegas

SuYweSkSBAWNWkSJGjDgNQ.text: Came here for St. Patrick's today because well fat chance I was getting into any of the bigger clubs.   It was fine. Nice vibe, lots of dancing, lots of drinking. DJ could have played less top 40, could actually let a song go most of the way through, etc.   Kudos to the 10/10 hottie for coming in with a belly-revealing t-shirt to dance by the way. I am sure I have no chance with you. But hey, at least I'm not the other brosephs who just started to grind on you without asking! ;)

lHyK0me6mVQ1g3GPxX-sYA.text: OMG.....see THIS is what Vegas is all about!! We stumbled upon this place by accident. The DJ (DJ T) who was a white guy.....was playing ALL of the latest HIP HOP hits!! I was totally shocked. My first time in Vegas and thanks to this place I truly had a blast! The bar tenders were over the top and a band played named Mr. & Mrs. Smith...they were freaking AWESOME!!! They sang all the latest hits R&B, pop...and they sound great. I danced the night away!!!

gwg6Nm6u7h70vTltgAiJEg.text: I opted to check this place out instead of hitting an overpriced nightclub. I kept hearing music and what sounded like a party. I was so glad I did. It was only $10 to get in and I had a great time. The bartenders are so much fun and very interactive with the crowd around the bar. They are quick to get your drink orders & are constantly checking on you and your drink orders. If you're in Vegas definitely hit this place up. The music was great and the crowd was fun! The bartenders alone make it worth it! I will for sure be back!!!!

6LvbBBm9vcZ4zZbjVRb17w.text: Our party of six enjoyed a night out at this outdoor bar. We paid $10/person cover, sat at the bar and very much enjoyed the entertaining bartenders. The music was great and the vibe was good. Will be back soon!

UYvCVCw91LQpLmgqxY1Xzw.text: Didn't get a chance to actually go inside and have a drink or a bite to eat but we did get a 100oz drink from here.  A friend and I split it since it was around $40.  Probably the best $20 I spent in Vegas.  The drink was delicious and was made from scratch (all the other places selling drinks in the 100oz containers all are made with a variety of different flavored slushy premix crap that is super sweet and contains little alcohol).  This one drink had us both feeling quite lovely.    The bartender was a bit standoffish probably from dealing with drunk people constantly... So I understood and she wasn't bad to look at so i cut her a break!!

UKm0zbnEVwdaE4CJh7HGMQ.text: High admission fees...long lines...bottle service...VIP line...see and be seen crowd...not here at Carnaval Court!  Loud, crowded, lively place...almost obnoxious with flair bartenders (these guys are good!) and strong drinks...more drunk out of state patrons than any other bar on the strip...crowd is not sophisticated and sometimes gross, yet it all works somehow and is a total blast.  A definite must hit on any wild night of drinking and reckless abandon on the strip.  Plenty of free live bands are always playing and as an added plus, they even have a few outdoor blackjack tables set up across from the bar.  Much as I try to avoid it, I always seem to end up here at some point of the night.  Fun times!

zqa9xgZcrfaR1KmEOJSSXQ.text: I have fond memories of this place.   Granted I was pretty wasted when I got here but still remember the great music of a live band playing in the background.   Now the thing about this place is that you need to be here early to take advantage of it's happy hour deals.  They do have a cover but if you get there early enough you can go in for free.    One of the things that I like about this place is that you get the club atmosphere of good music, good drinks without the whole dressing up to impress just to get in.    It's a fun place and you will enjoy it.

v59YK60y-iy7e3Z5fhyEsw.text: Great place to have fun! Awesome band and DJ. Hate the other overcrowded indoor nightclubs that are full of smoke,loud thumping music, and wall to wall people. This place is outdoor and they don't pack you in like sardines. The bartenders are friendly, the security people are nice, and the crowd is very diverse. Best part is the hourly free shots and the amazing flair performed by the bartenders.

zPGI_SWYaxc6-0O2PymIqQ.text: Got a beer, sat down for a little bit to enjoy while listening to a rock band The Crashers perform live. They were pretty good too. The environment was very inviting.   I saw Elvis as a waiter clearing off the tables. Great outdoor bar to just slam down a couple of beers to relax while listening to live music.

1HKZL3q-F5ypfAnw7oeHbg.text: Just got back  from a wild week in Vegas. We spent 3 of 4 nights here and had the best time! already planning our next trip for my birthday and carnaval is definitely on top of the list  ;)

hAl8iiIvJLq5sZG9Hk_2mQ.text: We arrived in Vegas around 10:45pm and were all ready to get on the Strip. My girlfriend requested we head over towards Harrah's. My inner monologue whined, "Whhhhyyyyyy??". NOW I know why.... Carnaval. Duane, you are legit my friend. He was flairin' it up for us and making me the strongest Red Bull-Vodkas I have ever thrown back. The DJ was seriously doing magic... we posted at the bar for a good two hours, creating new dance moves and getting hit on by guys from Boston and Australia. It was the perfect beginning to an unforgettable girls' trip... thank you, Duane and Carnaval!!

W8q7iqkquOG2P0hIj7lNsw.text: Stopped by here to check out the contest they were putting on. It was pretty much drunk girls shaking their goods for free alcohol!! It seemed crowded only for that reason. At the end everyone got free shots!!   Wasn't really entertained. Just wanted to see how silly it was.

LGYbor6_aIxSW1xvNcWvaA.text: This really is a fun bar! It is outside and has live music with plenty of space to dance.  The bar itself has awesome bartenders that are crazy and fun! It kinda reminds me of some of my favorite bars in Sturgis! The bartenders are always doing tricks, throwing bottles, doing fun shots, etc.  It does have a mixed crowd, but that is always a recipe for some awesome people watching, and you never know what is gonna happen.  I would definitely recommend this place. It is not a super chic, "Vegas" type place, so be forwarned!

8oDyqTmqSq3bMwTkSn3E1A.text: The Carnaval Court Bar & Grill is the infamous spot seen on TV where bartenders are throwing bottles around and making drinks in the process.  On this occasion, I did not go inside the bar, instead, I got a yard drink from the bar outside the entrance.  The yard drink is expensive, but is expected and the last time I had one, I was drunk for about eight hours.  The damage was $40, but worth it as I really liked the yard glass, which had the Welcome to Las Vegas sign at the bottom that lights up.  The drink itself wasn't as great as my previous one, but was strong enough to give me a bit of a buzz before I headed to the airport. I'm deducting one star because the drink wasn't as strong as I anticipated and didn't do much damage. I'll be back in the future and actually sit at the bar and watch the shows as they make drinks, but for now Carnaval Court Bar gets an average three stars.

wJGv63_M84O0ZdRLm3J-Ew.text: Pretty chill place for Vegas. It's outdoors, has a large bar in the middle, some casino tables, a stage, sitting area, dancing area.... you name it, it's here at Carnaval Bar. It does have an older crowd though. It's part of Harrah's so that's probably why. The younger folks usually hang out at more hip places... haha. But we were meeting people here, so that's why we came. It's A-Okay in my books.

i_7e8vsqVuA5SgqLcEKrCQ.text: Had a great time at Carnaval. Great bartenders with a fun show. The DJ was great and the band in between sets was a blast.

VQseg-BXYFM6bzJiMvN5CA.text: Real fun place to grab a couple of day drinks; my buddy and I had a great time.   Keep in mind that this bar is outdoors and quality of your time here is really contingent on the weather.   The crowd here was definitely a melting pot of all cultures and race's...which is actually part of the bars appeal IMO.  The "flare" bar tending here is absolute sight to see, their performances are really unbelievable. That being said, make sure you tip well.   I wouldn't make this place my nighttime destination, but if you're trekking the strip and need a place to wind down, people watch, and get some R&R in while simultaneously entertained by the bartending...i highly recommend this place -- you won't be disappointed.   One of the bar tenders there, Robyn I think--she is gorgeous!! And I don't say that about many people.

N6OkE6iqZWqHzAu05Nookg.text: I have to reiterate some of the claims that alot of people are saying about this place. My wildest moments in Vegas were probably had had at this venue. Carnival Court is probably the most underrated venue in all of LV, probably because it doesn't get much hype as some of the other snootier, fancier, hotel clubs get. There are no excessively long lines to wait in, there are no bouncers that you have to tip, there are no outrageous entry fees, there are no separate "female only" lines, there are no mandatory male / female ratios needed to enter. All you need is a good party vibe and maybe a few other folks looking to have a good time.  There are two good things about this venue: The first are the flair bartenders. I dunno if he's still there, but there's this "asian Tom Cruise" who can juggle Grey Goose bottles all day while pouring 12 shot glasses in a matter of seconds. These guys know how to work the crowd, and the best part happens when there are $1 shots. The other good thing is the live band that plays all your favorite music. They play a good mash up of rock, 80's, and generally any feel good party song. Then they take a break, so the DJ comes out and he starts spinning some hip hop. I've taken all my friends to this venue who have never been there, and they've all had good things to say about it.  If you're looking for a non-pretentious place to party, Carnival Court is it.

VbNPfx5YEw6jeDavJhxilg.text: Great staff and service! Arguably the best bar to day drink in all of Las Vegas. You also get your money's worth with every drink you by. The rotating love bands they have here actually are great too. Come ready to party and you will not be disappointed!!!

ellwHDfubZV_j38-LmjgCQ.text: I love this cheesy hoe down.  If you want to sit outside, listen to some live music, and heckle bartenders this is a great place.  The drunk people watching is TOP notch,  They typically have cover-bands 80s music, current stuff, etc that are really good.  It's completely outside so keep that in mind. Definitely somewhat of a tourist trap but they make STRONG drinks with heavy pours!!!!  And you get a show with those pours!

K9CrvxF_0_ff1ouihJ8ypg.text: Tip your bartenders!   I always try to come here when I am in Vegas. Unpretentious, fun staff; nice looking dancers and blackjack dealers; good and affordable drinks; and above all else, a great time. Check it out and you won't be disappointed, the music is great, the flair is world-class, and there is always fun to be had.

Yw4C4zwhH1_xQzBSxtglTQ.text: Oh how I love this place! This is always my 1st destination on the strip. Once you witness flair bartending at its best, every other place on the planet will not measure up. The bartendars really put on a show and make your experience memorable. FYI - drinks portions are generous and you will get smashed out of your mind..quickly!  I always visit when there is a live band. Great talents playing rock, hip hop and pop. No worries if its cold out because the giant ceiling heaters keep you warm as well as the dancing cage girls.  On a separate note, start off with a killer Mai Tai first.

adDuQ-9XGGq2CLbgvzu-rg.text: Great drinks. I like the flare bartenders but they can be a friendlier. They cut off my friend cuz he was trying to be funny. Every time I go there I have fun but the last time wasnt fun.

v4_3SoueyQsb9XoZRT_EbQ.text: One of my fav spots in Vegas! I love going here to sit and watch bands & the bartenders!! My hubby & I came here on 8/7/13, there was an awesome band playing, The Crashers, we really enjoyed it!! Everyone was dancing & having a great time!!   The only downside is the price of the drinks, very expensive, but it is Vegas!!  What do you expect???

5ExnqDmP_WvAuIWaZxon-g.text: $10 entrance during Memorial Day weekend!  Our group of 10+ girls and guys were not about to pay $100+ to get into a fancy club with no places to sit, so we decided to go to Carnaval instead. It's an outdoor club/bar with plenty of tables and chairs and a big dancefloor. I love that it was a casual place, so our boyfriends didn't have any trouble getting in with a hat on or sneakers.

xmRu3TYoN9WYxor5RDEzig.text: This place is amazing! The drinks were yummy and the service was awesome. My best friend and I came to Vegas on a girls trip. On our last day there, we went to a pool party and stopped by Carnival Court on the way back to the hotel. We stayed here and danced for hours! We enjoyed interacting with the other court-siders and the music. Mr. & Mrs. Smith was performing and we just loved every second of it. The bartenders were super entertaining and were very personable. I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back!

tkUzz7_xkGz5kNMCy6MoOA.text: Always a nice place to go listen to some live bands in the open air, they mostly play TOP40 stuff and most of the bands are pretty good!!  It's pretty fun to watch the crowd of all ages dance and get silly.  The drinks were ok they could be a lil stronger.

Z0a6wufqbf63sXYTonNDKQ.text: DUDE so i go over to buy those big blue drinks and i spent 60$ for each drink ( i bought two) probably because the choice  of my drink was more pricey (red bull vodka) its cool its vegas no worries.  I saw that this place had a dance floor and i was like HMMM.So i grabbed my bestie and we walked in no problem/no charge.  mind you this was during the day probaly 3 on saturday. We go in and dance our butts off! DJ you are awesome and the best part about this is its a good way to get your night started (or your day that turned into night when we were done!)  literally got in that place at 3 ish and finshed dancing at 7.  it was such a blast we didnt realize how much time had gone by.  none the less this place was seriously one of the best experiances that i had!  im am gonna hit up this place when i go back!

b3nSJ8VJznVVOrzvdLag-w.text: You guys really need to check ID's on credit card purchases! I understand it is Vegas and it gets extremely busy, but we got 3 credit card purchases done to our account that wasn't even us. Now we have to wait for reimbursement from our credit card company.

UlfoYGtCsyOUxAEZLDjOdg.text: This place is defiantly on that you must check out. Always have a good time there. 99% of the people here go to simply have a great time and leave the attitude and egos at home. Kinda does suck that you have to walk all the way to the casino to use the restroom, but other than that, it's a great chill place to hang out, dance, and enjoy the live music.

f7M9nR4jG2GNeqpfZP8FiA.text: I'm giving this place 4 stars for two reasons only. 1. You have to walk back into the casino to use the bathroom, which sucks when you broke the seal, and 2. it's outdoors and in the summer time in Vegas being outside blows.  But enough with my complaints, this bar is definitely a good time. The atmosphere, the sites, and the live music is always a plus in my book. I would say that this place is much better suited for groups though. Not just you and your buddy hitting up the town. I have been here twice and each time I have had a blast. Let's be honest, it's Vegas, you can do and be anything you want to be!!

DvKS5aidkepVyOCjoYZ9Gg.text: Place is a blast. Mr. & Mrs. Smith are awesome. Great atmosphere. Mixed crowd. Dress however you want to dress. Would be 5 stars but beers are steep and the Late night DJ is kind of a douche that complained when the crowd didn't want to dance to techno.

hAtyArw2994aNOcTm4qcbw.text: This place is an all out party and was an awesome place to spend my first night in Vegas.  They even have fire juggling bartenders!  So, I ordered some beers and shots of Jager for me and my hottie accomplice and was pleasantly surprised when the Jager shots came in solo cups (it was probably as much booze as 3 shots).  We spent the rest of the night dancing to sweet cover tunes from a band that could actually play and actually sounded really good.  I'd recommend this place to young couples looking to have a fun night of drinking, dancing and partying.  Even if you're not into rowdy bars it's likely that you'll have a fun time at Carnival Court.

JCOWRM5ITYVviTLYXYlo-A.text: Nth much to see from this place. It is kinda random Djs music and hits. I went there expecting that there would be more exciting hits and beats yet it turned out to be couple of people there and not much things going on. Not good for the millenials

BCMqGa-KTk4BbndjT4-GNg.text: Love this place! Always go here at least 2 nights out of our 3-4 night trips. All the bartenders have always been great. Even when it's packed around the bar, it's never been a long wait to get a drink.  Love the variety of music, whether it's a band or dj, always have a blast.  Each time I've met some great people there and had fun random conversations.   I like the more laid back, casual places over the jam packed like sardines, clubs.  This place is perfect, if you want to sit and chill or get up and dance, plenty of space for either.

U3eLtCnaOhx4Vhi43BMDsw.text: Great place to party in Vegas. The bartenders are amazing. There are live bands performing (mostly cover bands) and gaming tables on site. Located between Harrahs and LINQ.

i0YytHjzOiWffAuRDGjAKA.text: Super awesome service and super cool bartenders. They also play a great variety of old school jams plus today's hits. Had such a blast here on a random Sunday night. They also provide propane heaters since it is outdoors and gets chilly. Very accommodating. There's also tables to gamble if you like. They do free shots and are so so entertaining with live music and very outgoing bartenders. They don't carry cognac though which is my to go drink but it was still a good time.

USZewJwu7m_67sQRTnE2Rg.text: It's like being at a college party.  -VERY casual and laid-back crowd -Everyone stumbles in here drunk, girls somewhat slutty, guys either come here to pre-game, end the night, or find them a drunk girl to take back to the hotel.  -The night we went there was ultra-EDM music, after 10 minutes of it even Calvin Harris would say enough! -The DJ himself looked like was strung out on K2, coke, heroine, and E, he just kept leaving the DJ station, letting whole songs play for 6 minutes and 22 secs -Dance floor was live!! and energy was at 1,000%, you may leave here sweating.  -If you want to get laid, don't bother going to the bigger clubs, just come here and take your pick (#creepLife) lol

4PejOjGUnox5FkZAYHcqbw.text: Very casual style outdoor fun bar/nightclub...always my favorite place to start the night.

SDHmWnjs35h7ZjOf_8UyDw.text: Ah yes, Carnaval.  Shut the place down on back to back nights and had a blast.  I can't remember the DJ's name, but he had a pretty good mix going on when the bands weren't playing.  I think it was the same guy the nights of 8/19 and 8/20; however, I could be wrong.  And to the chick from Dayton, give me back my 50th anniversary Starboard coozie!  I definitely remember Mr. $ Mrs. Smith who was the band that played on Saturday night, and they were fuggin awesome.  Very energetic and cranked out lots of radio hits and 90's g-funk rap.  They have "free shots" every now and then at the bar which actually cost $5.  A bartender stands up on the bar and pours directly into your mouth until you say stop or he thinks you've had enough.  The buckets of beer are clutch since it'll save you some trips to the bar.  You can just put them on the edge of the stage.  We must have had 5 or 6 at a time lined up.  My tabs were pretty ugly both nights, but there was a large group of us, and we drink like fish.  It's a covered open air area which reminds of the old Bohager's in Baltimore if anyone remembers that.  The one drawback is there aren't any bathrooms inside, so you have to leave and go into the Harrah's bathroom closest to the piano bar.

rmNAZUJJ2gJX02axzLo74Q.text: Overall we had a good time. The band was good and played great music. The drinks are good and pretty strong. It had heaters on outside becuase it was a little cold out and there was places to sit.  However since there's no cover and right on the strip there are definitely some extra weirdos that hang out here.  I wish it was policed by their security a little bit more.    Or if the charged a small cover fee or something to keep the riffraff out

qqkX4y6rAmA9dmG2NZBLVw.text: Fun place but I have been pick pocketed here back in 2014 as there can at times be little gangs of thieves looking for their next victims. If you see dudes in derby's be careful. Also watch your drinks. Multiple times we have had dudes swip beers . Bartenders here though are a blast for most part. Music here is fantastic . I have had literally the most fun in Vegas here meeting new people and dancing the night away. After Superbowl party here is a blast! This place is for dancing and flirting. It can get chilly in spots here in the winter. Usually on weekends they have blackjack going as well. Prices here great compared to other nightclubs but you do get what you pay for. People are dressed very casual here, both women and men. Sometimes they hit you with a $5 cover and that is usually on weekends or big events. Been coming here for years, and will keep coming here, just be careful as they do not really keep out the punks at this venue.

71PRgW53YT1oQBhRD1dwYw.text: This used to be my favorite bar. It was more for Mr and Mrs Smith and their R&B concert. They have since changed formats and male singers (I heard he is a Chippendale dancer now... Makes sense). Now Mr. And Mrs. Smith are alt / classic rock. That's okay but the only reason I came here every time I came to Vegas was FOR THE AWESOME R&B concert that Mr. and Mrs put on. Now. I'm going to have to find a new haunt. Please Mr. And Mrs. Smith, bring back the R&B. If you are wondering why the dance floor clears when you are on stage, this is why. The DJ (who looks a little like Andy Dick) is pretty good though. He keeps the R&B vibe kicking. So 4 stars for him.

ZMIoiF6ID13sMG3qtdvXJQ.text: Went here midweek around 9pm and it was pretty empty. When we first arrived there was a band playing which was very good, playing mostly 70's and 80's music. After maybe a half hour a deejay took over. There is no glitz or glam here, not the interior of what most people envision as a typical Vegas nightclub. It's pretty bare and stark with a large circular bar when you first walk in. On the other side of the bar are tables and a dance floor in front of the stage. Friendly bartenders, older crowd, very casual, and good people watching. I don't really have anything negative to say. But some describe this place as the best bar in Vegas and that's where I disagree. If your younger and use to glitz and glam of Vegas nightlife you won't like this place. If your older and want to listen to live bands without the young crowd you will love it here.

14pKw449k-JgeWlR3mKECQ.text: This place is so much fun!!!! If your looking just for something between a club and a chill spot ...def go here !!!! Good vibes, great music !!!!! Dj was killing it the whole time.  And the bartenders !!!! They were busting out some tricks the whole night

D_hhsHN0o2IkqKqUweQwAg.text: Best party spot in Las Vegas ! ! ! ! Live music and the awesomesest Flair Bartenders EVER !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Drink prices aren't that bad and well served ! ! ! ! !

tfzVHmdb8DbTHO9en2ba2g.text: If you're looking for a late night spot to have fun, dance to some good music, and meet some beautiful women (depending on the day of the week) this place is it! No cover! Drinks are a bit pricey.. but you are in Las Vegas after all! Mingle, have fun, and definitely don't be shy!

8wl0nwI4bPZgR1xkacfZIQ.text: This bar was an absolute blast. The bartenders were awesome, especially Jamie. We were entertained for hours- he even bought us a round of birthday shots! By far the most fun we had while in Vegas, I highly recommend visiting if you're in the area.

IeYSaSHbJ8wwu_c9OyktUQ.text: Best place to go in vegas in my opinion! I go there everytime great entertainment on Friday- Sunday. The Whip Its are a must see from 1-6 i think and then Mr. and Mrs Smith from 8-12. The bartenders are awesome and heavy on the pour. It is the only place you see all different types of people and all ages just dancing, drinking and enjoying themself without having to dress up. There is no cover charge until they get really packed so make sure to get there early and don't leave your table. The only thing i would say is the seating is a bit sparce and some over the waitress are not too friendly. Go go Go

mMRLQS_yoWK_VBMHhkg_oA.text: Have now been here a couple of times and i gotta say i dig this spot. I'm not about fancy clubs and all that. I like chill spots with GOOD music more than anything. So when looking for a spot to hang out, listen to music that makes me shake my booty, all while enjoying a good strong drink.....here it is! Perfect spot for all the above...and i don't have to dress up as if going to a fancy dancy spot...which i am totally ok with!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shots! Shots! Shots!
Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DJ spinning some great music!

6bqcSOIUeWEex9wsU4sNmw.text: Wound up here on a whim, following the music and were very pleasantly surprised. What was originally one drink lasted quite a bit longer thanks to some very friendly and attentive bartenders, and an ample amount of red-faced, good -natured tourists. The body shot whistle got old after the first, by the fourth it would have been a killer but the atmosphere and the music made up for it. Definitely an older crowd (30's, 40s) which we liked, as it cuts down (usually) on random jerkishness.  Next time we're back we'll definitely stop by for a few rum drinks, maybe some blackjack.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dance floor getting started up.

BJTzlDcLIU_H5cSJX_sH8w.text: This bar is amazing, but much more so when Michael is there! Not only is he attentive, but he's engaging.  My boyfriend and I literally come to this bar every time we're in vegas in hopes to see him! If you get the opportunity to have Michael as your bartender just plan on canceling your plans for the day, because you won't need to go anywhere else! He's the full vegas experience!!

pxl0jB9YGLFFQZEexcwYHw.text: For over a decade we've spent every trip following Robert aka Awesome and its made every trip worth it.  There is no better bar tender no better service and after all these years we call him our friend.  Love you Rob. Love all the guys at the court! Flippy, Jamie,  Rene, Charlie,  Steve,  Erik.. you guys Rock!!

pnB8ZPYXyat698HuonQXFQ.text: I can't count the number of times I have pushed and rushed past this place on past weekends in my home-away-from-home.  always blaring music, sometimes from a half-talented band - and always a line of douchenozzles trying to get in  but this weekend was a Vegas trip of a different vibe - hanging with non-gamblers - non-gamblers that like to dance.  So barney B waited, got tagged, and hung loose.  douchenozzles represent?  check. half talented band cranking?  well, to be honest the band did exactly waht they needed to do - so I'd give them more credit than just 'half talented' and did our friends have a blast? double check.  ok, there's not a chance in hell I am ever coming back here - but it was enjoyable seeing my friends sweat off beer on the dance area, as well as watch random 'couples' break out into impromptu lap dances.  and if this is your scene and can deal with the inevitable drunk DN grinding on you, dude or girl - then swing on by - they like to party and make noise and so do you, right?

E3qEF04hPiqwGB3orER4dQ.text: People who visit Vegas must really like paying ridiculous prices for not so great drinks  because I'm pretty surprised by the glowing reviews. Yes, the atmosphere is pretty nice, which is what drew me to the place initially. The loud music, and the stage at the back with performances happening nightly are appealing. Still, the Gin & Tonic was $ 12, and it wasn't very good. If your're here for good drinks, there are much better places out there. If, on the other hand, you're here for the atmosphere, you will have a good time.

MDaIqnK1e__3x7EYT5wIlw.text: My experiences here have always been a blast.  First visit here, my boyfriend and I had our first kiss ::AWWWWW::  But thats not what you all want to hear. HA! When we got here, we were already intoxicated, but he decided to go ahead and order 2 margarita on the rocks, big souvenir cup thingys which were like $40 each. I think we both had taken like 4 sips before he swung his arms in the air because of excitement that they were playing his "jam," and WHAM! There went our drinks! Lmao. What a waste!!! Tsk, tsk. We weren't going to let that ruin our night though. The DJ was playing good music, so we stuck around and danced a bit. My second visit there, was for a cousins 21st birthday. The bartenders seem very full of energy, and seem to enjoy their jobs. Making it even exciting to see them make your drink. Our job was definitely done here. Getting the birthday boy plastered! This time, there was a band playing. I honestly, didn't care for the band. But I mean, its Vegas, and we were with a big group of people who were going to make wherever we were fun.  I'd say this is a good spot to START your night. :)

GwD6i8kFqM7ERvBSpZt30Q.text: If you don't mind paying high prices for drinks, fighting a crowded bar to get a drink, likely getting a crappy drink, and a live band (but not necessarily a good one) then this place is for you.  Sure the flair is fun to watch but I think they focus too much on the flair and not enough of what goes into the glass. If you want to enjoy the flair, get a drink in the casino and go outside with it. They don't care or know the difference.

vQit4LE1wslAXKCJ2lKkrw.text: This place is great! free to get in if your here early............hehehe we were since we were staying next door at the Harrahs! Daily Booty contest at 3:30pm and overall this place is a great place to drink and get ripped! I mean the atmosphere is awesome.......seems everyone that comes to this place is open to conversation etc....not pretetntious, like other spots in Vegas. I had a blast here! The drinks here are STRONG!!!! i WATCHED THESE DUDES MAKE SOME HUGE POURS! tHye should clal this place Wino court! Shake & bake seal of approval.!

tNiVdbzw2u-P0RJMAvw7Lg.text: One word: the shit.  I come here everytime when I'm in Vegas on Saturday afternoons. Go here in the day time for drinks and fun! There's a disco band called Wonderboogie and they do a spectacular job in getting the crowd into the festivities and will do shout-outs for free shots!! The flair bartenders put on a great show so tip them well!   If it's your birthday or you have a bachelor/bachelorette, this is an even better place for day time fun!!  A definite MUST when you're in Vegas. Highly recommended.

a_ZAKDu7GfGL4Wd2h9nZmA.text: I really like it here.  The bands are normally pretty good top 40's cover bands.  They have go go dancers in high platforms.  No cover or lines if you come in early.  Fun flair bartenders.

kNPYemFf4GhRSN6Zaj-qrw.text: GIRLS BEWARE!!!  This place actually gets 5 stars for the fun bartending experience and the staff's helpfulness....but I give 1 star to make sure other users take note of this post.  Vegas is Vegas....people will drink and be crazy and let loose but all in all, want to be in a safe environment.  This place has the unfortunate luck to have a resident predator they can't seem to rid themselves of and I think ladies need to be aware.  His name is Francois...for lack of a better description...he looks like a meathead on steroids....this night he was in a tight tattoo design t-shirt.  Short, crewcut-like blondish/lighter color hair.  And there is nothing French or even the hint of an accent about him.  He says he owns the place, will buy you a helicopter, just a whole bunch of BS.  Guys like this are seriously a dime a dozen and if you are out for a fun time, he's almost entertaining in the crap he is trying to convince you of...but I'm sure there are plenty of gals who buy it.  He suggests dancing on the dance floor which is a short walk down in front of the bar...I'm up for a dance in a crowd, why not, we're just having fun...but when I ask why my girlfriend isn't joining...or why I can't go get her...he is kind of pushy and trying to get me dance...give me the fur coat off the DJs back.  Then the rude, crude, very sexual and aggressive/borderline scary comments begin.  He brings another guy who he says was a fireman over who is just looking as predator-ish as Francois.  Again, this is all par for the course in Vegas...douchebags.  But..this guy apparently sets up camp nightly here at the Carnaval Court outside Harrah's and then moves to the Linq late late (while his wife is at home!!  Double douchbag)....spewing the SAME story to any gal who will listen and fall for it.  My concern is his very aggressive and violent sexual comments which are probably indicative of his overall demeanor.  What happens when a girl wises up later on and tries to leave and is abused when there isn't a crowd around??  I think this guy should be 86'd from this bar....even though he is technically doing nothing illegal in all his lying, guests shouldn't have to worry about their safety when they are just trying to have some good Vegas fun.  SO GALS...BEWARE.  LOOK OUT FOR THIS GUY...I wish I had a pic but all the staff knows about him and they just don't know what to do about him.  Spread the word, be safe, have fun....and definitely have a cocktail with the uber talented bartenders here.  They all get 5 stars for sure!!

KcTG7FKkFtAQFLQ40Hg8og.text: This was a place I went to quite frequently with friends from work, especially after I celebrated my divorce (from my 1st husband)- before there was a cover charge. I saw Cook E Jar and the Crumbs (Las Vegas stereotype performer with the big hair, big shades, hairy chest, gold chains, sparkly costumes, who is a pretty good performer I might add) and my favorite lounge band- 650 (from Hawaii- but I don't know if they are still performing anymore- they are soooo good). The bartenders would do all these fancy tricks. There were lots of people around (dancing on the small dance floor, in front of the stage) and lots of people passing by would stop to see what the heck was going on- on stage and around the circular outside bar- unique outside setting (but comes in handy for when you want to cool off from shaking your booty). There was table seating around but usually a person in your group had to get the table to save- or stalk someone you think is leaving. Parking is at the casino garage and it's a long walk from the casino but it's such a fun place (it's worth it, but if you're drunk, on the other hand, it might seem like an eternity).

6-kH79SpoMeIKDIEBwchPA.text: Oh yeah....Carnival Court is definitely the place to be, for me that is....LOVE this place...To be able to go dancing where you don't have to really dress up and meeting new friends...no cover charge, come as you are...

4eA_RA8BIS6PKFmvuEmQbQ.text: In the past 3 years that my wife and I have been coming to Vegas we always hit up Carnaval Court. "Awesome", and the other guys there were responsible for me passing out shortly after. Gotta love the "free shots". Music is always bumoing, the other patrons are engaging and friendly. I will be back November 12th.... get ready

SDst3MmlNU02g-wYG-JdIA.text: So...the live music does not rock my world here, but the bartending is where the show is at.  I am usually not down w/ paying a cover just for a bar, but I think I had at least 2 drinks poured into my mouth while I was hanging out, so it probably made up for it.    If you want to watch flair, this is the place, and if you want to avoid the thumping trance and techno, well, pony up to the Carnival Bar!

gko13ga-ccRU19Zfv_eegA.text: Hands down, this is my favorite place in Vegas.  The bartenders are so much fun to watch!  You will have so much fun at this bar!  Go with your girlfriends because there are tons of guys here!  =)  **Updated 7/23/08** Still my favorite spot in Vegas.  Try to get a seat in front of Mig, Christian, or Steve.  They are the best to watch!

5Xhg1vsB-eel2-DLknvHHQ.text: Why waste your time and money on touristy night clubs when you get party here?!  The music's great, it has a huge dance floor, reasonable drinks, and cute bartenders! After spending most of the weekend in Vegas dressed up in heels and tight dresses, my girls and I were thrilled to walk into CC in jeans and flip flops and stayed until 4am without even realizing it! Such a great time!!

Bi7-tuvUvhwjl6x8q0jL9w.text: Live music, alcohol, funny bartenders who do crazy tricks, and misters for the hot, hot heat... what else is better?!?!?  I love this outdoor bar. Everytime I go to Vegas I make an attempt to  go here. The bartenders are hilarious (somewhat perverted) and very talented. I always buy a 1/2 yard of some sort of drink here which usually makes me pass out somewhere later in the afternoon. Last year I passed out at La Salsa at Caesar's after I finished my drink. The bartender Flippy usually has a heavy hand.  From the water/alcohol fights between bartenders, to the girl customers shoving tip money between their boobs for the bartenders to get... It's just a really fun place to be in the daytime in Vegas. During the band's break the bartenders usually have contests or games of some sort to get the crowd riled up.   The first time I came here was in August 2004 and the bartenders have remained the same. I wouldn't leave this job either considering the massive amount of money it seems they make in tips. It can get a bit raunchy at times, but it's always a good time (pending weather of course).

qRzWa13iK1Pc58vc2jgN8A.text: On our yearly "guys trip to Vegas" we always make a point to spend some time at the Carnival bar.  No cover (in the daytime), lots of friendly tourists, a great cover band, amazing flair bartenders, no dress code (as far as I can tell) and very little attitude.  The place is a big outdoor venue and a great place for some daytime drinking.   Nighttime is pretty fun too!  Its a great alternative to waiting hours in line at some overpriced "ultra-lounge" and spending a fortune on drinks once you get in.

dFrqVoWfBEcRSRvcK_XSuw.text: I've been here many many a time, but the most recent time I was there they were charging a cover for locals...  As a local, I don't expect everything to be free to me, but for a place like Carnival Court to be charging...  That just doesn't seem right...  Don't think I'll be heading back here anytime soon...  -JW

EBh7nRg9QpPJyuPXcivGpQ.text: Had so much fun that this place!  Flippy and Zach and the Asian guy were the absolute best!!!!!  We drank there from 8-12 in the morning and they all had such a great attitude and were all-around nice guys.  It was impossible not to want to buy a lot of drinks from them.  Love these guys!  Definitely going to come back to visit them.  It was my birthday and they gave me a shot of god knows what that had a giant whipped creme penis on it lol.  So fun.  MUST GO!

PRkm_qC9WVo76ZzphKvb5w.text: Hands down best bar I've EVER been to! Flippy was our bartender and he was AMAZING! We showed up at noon on a Saturday (when they opened) and sat at the bar (A MUST).  We were there first, so no problem.  We were there for FOUR hours drinking one of those like 4 ft long drinks that comes on a necklace so when you are so drunk you can't hold your drink up it doesn't fall over haha.  We probably got 10 free shots while we were there.  The bartenders are "flair" tenders and are amazing at what they do.  We had the best time ever and are looking forward to going back, hopefully this weekend! Don't be afraid to get the big drink and tip! It's worth it! They'll give you all the free shots you want of their "secret" mix! Although we did tip a lot and that might be why! I LOVE YOU FLIPPY!!

-del9wxO3ZHkHS0NghfnPQ.text: Always a good time for plenty of alcohol, drunk tourist, and good music! Best in the warm weather!

8xI57Ep_5X5L5bhT2IhKSQ.text: When friends and I were in Vegas last month, us girls were looking for a place to dance one of the nights we would be there. We didn't really feel like dealing with any of the insanely packed dance clubs that feature celebs and high priced covers, so someone mentioned this place. Since we were right across the street staying at the Mirage, we were down to give it a try.   I have to say this is the most fun I've had dancing in Vegas.   There was a live band playing which played a mixture of classic rock, mainstream rock, etc. Then around midnight, a DJ starting playing 90s rap music which brought us back to our high school days.  Not everyone was dancing, so it was a perfect sized area for those that wanted to be up by the stage.   The bartenders were entertaining with their bottle juggling and they seemed to make decently booze filled drinks, but the prices made my bunghole cringe! $16 for a long island in a small plastic cup? I think my friends vodka/cran was $13.  What I always like to do is bring a flask and fill it up in the room before I head anywhere on the strip because I'm cheap like that. Then order a coke/juice and fill it up when they're not looking. This place is dark enough and there's quite enough seats that you most definitely won't be caught. Screw em for charging these inflated prices!  The DJ will often throughout the night offer up free shots from the bartenders to get the crowd lively. I opted to get a free shot, but it wasn't worth the $5 tip that my husband left. It was like a lime margarita mix. PFFT.  Also, this place is filled with people in their late 20s-50s. A wide variety of ages can be seen here. At least the night we came.  It was kind of funny. The DJ put on a Michael Jackson song, and my husband started busting out the moon walk and you could see a flock of cougars swarm him like flies around shit. I couldn't stop laughing, but we all had fun, so it was worth it.  Whenever I'm back in Vegas, I'll be sure to stay at this end of the strip just so I can go back to Carnaval Court.  BTW, where's the bathroom? You get dinged a star for this since you almost made me pee my pants.

rdi_GT2XpAllwATC8bSafA.text: I was surprised I had a good time here my second time. I came for a birthday but was not excited to come because my first time was boring. The second time I was surprised it was busy because it was a Tuesday. It's fun to go when you're with a group. The best part was the tricks that the bartenders did when they pour drinks or shots! The music is older music but it fits the crowd.

15f4Hy5XKt8aJtYlr1Mcng.text: Anyone who gives this place a bad review after one experience, go back! Your being unfair. This place I've been to every time my friend has been in town (so probably about 4 times) and then once when another friend came into town who's never been. I would choose this bar over any night club. There's no cover charge, drinks are amazing, BARTENDERS AND THE ATMOSPHERE they bring are the reason why I love it! I definitely come here only when I have the means to uh....get drunk that night. To me it's not just a bar you go to to have one casual drink, no, you go there to DRINK. Or atleast start or end your night there. The tall drinks they serve well worth the price tag, the load those things with whatever you want! You only need one! There's a bartender there I absolutely adore, remembers me every time. Haven't been back in a few months, I miss it, but like I said, it's a place to get drunk and well, I haven't been doing that hahahha. Can't wait to go back. Love love love.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite bartender on a slower afternoon.

c4DzEHzWsA80m1DNFEB2dw.text: This place is my Disneyland!! There's always magic happening here! Drinks are expensive, but they pour with a heavy hand! Two drinks in and you're having an amazing time watching the bartenders flip bottles and pour shots into girls mouths.  The crowd is insanely diverse!!! You have a bachelorette party sitting next to a group of 50 yr olds who are next to a table of firemen who are next to people who just walked out of a convention, but everyone is having a great time!! Partied one night in shorts and a tshirt and the next night in a tie and slacks, why you ask? Because this is Carnival Court, and the rules don't apply here, just getting drunk and having a good time!! Spend at least one night here and enjoy the break from the overpriced pretentious Vegas club scene and have the time of your life!!

0bQj1_j2RjePcacVusOdAA.text: Located between Harrah's and The Quad on the famous Las Vegas Strip. The Carnival Court is a covered open air bar, and it is a total blast! So much better then the DB ridden night clubs. No cover charge and they have live music, no you didn't misread that LIVE MUSIC I say!So I say if you are in the neighborhood stop in,have a touch of the creature and get your groove on. Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

4vAhJShq4qOqVVO0J7VwBA.text: We come to Vegas every year & love his place. The bartenders have been here for years and are absolutely excellent.  My husband and I just can't get over Jamie. He is just a great soul, creates amazing drinks and is very fun. Flippy the other bartender is so fun to watch.  The live bands are great and the atmosphere is super fun and laid back.  Highly recommend the place for the afternoon hours.

6Oe7RP2IBdRoUWlrJujDOA.text: Loved it! Great service, bartenders, waitress, dancers and dealers... It's free all day, and make sure you are there around 9 pm...get a bracelet and then you can come and go as you please without paying cover. It's a good time :-)

Ac4xXOsW3N2JLR0VIzZPIw.text: This place is nice but i wish they wouldnt id me so much and i would stay longer i would love to dance the night away tho with my girl

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UwF22bwXLmVvav6shxCuQQ.text: Vegas is about glamourous hotels and trendy clubs. But when your feet refuse another night of suffering in high heels yet you still want to get your party on, you go to Carnival Court Bar.  Where else can you...  1) watch bartenders do flairs and tricks? 2) enjoy a live band singing and rocking out to radio hits? They're very good btw.  3) relive moments of MJ's legacy? It wasn't really him of course. But the crowd went crazy over his moonwalks and crotch-grabs. 4) watch the "sexiest DJ in Vegas" spin? Can't say I agree with the sexiest part, but she's one of those platinum blonde barbie girls. I guess that's sexy. 5) form a dance circle and do the running man in flipflops? 6) have a full yard margarita strapped to your neck as you grind to Flo-rida?  Yes, there were spilled drinks on the ground. Big deal. Its the same with clubs that people pay 30 bucks to get in. It's not the place, but what you make of it. So if you know how to have fun, you can have fun anywhere! =)

034mj1uVTStzWACgSiwAGQ.text: Great bar to party at when in Vegas bartenders are very entertaining with there flair techniques Bubbles best waitress at the bar

6EgsB6mn8YCeK3PMtdPbGw.text: I don't remember much about my night out there but I definitely remember a good time. No idea how I got back to my hotel or when or how I left.  However I can tell you that this place has a great location, great service and an amazing show from the bartenders.  Definitely make sure that you tip the bartenders because they are on "fire".  Also, the live band was a good time as well.  It was the Crashers. I did request a song via Tweet but I don't remember if they ever actually played it hahah.  Definitely good times had.

C8D1PopdP0IUAly6AoyKBw.text: Love this place. They play amazing music, and there's no cover charge. Great atmosphere!

ela9L5aZosbDxgVR0AgtLA.text: Crazy fun- thanks droids band!  Dancing under the Vegas sky, drinks, laughs, what more could I want?  Shout out to Chris!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Droids band was awesome, shout out to Chris, so much fun!

L2KFZ3vl3oqlWl90MSRgcQ.text: Why do you serve warm beer?  I ordered a coors light bottle at 2:45 and it was warm. How is it ok to charge $10 for a beer and serve it warm?

Xfd4-d3N0rsgJlnAnxDHEw.text: While this place never ends in a fun morning for me, it is always a blast the night of!!!! It's worth a trip just to watch the bartenders throwing things in the air and balancing things on their heads! They usually have some really fun love bands (although the last time we were here the band looked like smelly nerds and were rather rude..)  My favorite bar in all of Vegas!

AnlDUeM9G_94ARWH-boC9w.text: I like this place. We accidentally just went in here while walking the strip.  It has a pretty big dance floor with some good music playing. Either a live band/coverband/or a DJ spinning tracks.  Nice thing is that it is open so it doesn't get so hot.   It is a plus that it was free to get in as well. So if you are on a budget, looking to get drunk and listen to music and dance, check this place out.  Only problem is the dance floor has like a concrete type flooring so if you are wearing some nice shoes you will prob wear out the soles if you know how to work your feet.

Gub-G4dFaxpvaDu8oLC4hw.text: i hate to admit it, but, i really like this place. my buddies might just tar and feather me for saying that.   the place is a really cool hang out. the fact that it's free (if you get there early enough) and have a live band with dancing make it pretty sweet. the crowd is always chill and fun. lots of out of towners drawn in by the loud music.   the bar is set up great for the flair shows they put on. i no longer pay them any mind, unless i'm waiting for my drink. for the most part, you can see when they're ready to light something on fire or pour shots down patrons throats so you can plan ahead on ordering your drink. one bartender there, flippy, i've seen for a long time, is a pretty cool dude. the drink prices are not THE most expensive, but, definitely not cheap. pretty much almost club prices.   the "thrashers" (i think that's their name) play here most times that i've been here. they play '80s and '90s rock and take requests. in between the band, they have a DJ spinning top 40. later in the evening, and even in the afternoons during the weekend, the dancefloor gets pretty lively.   whenever mama and i are in town and want to dance the night away, we make it a point to make it out here.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_BrKKEEp9QwLXmJlbZAi-Q.text: This is literally the only place we go to dance anymore.  Varied crowd, great people watching, drinks are strong, bartenders are friendly and talented and make strong drinks (especially if you tip well!).  I love that it's outdoors and center strip! Live band and DJ, doesn't matter, both rock!  My only wishes are that they'd serve food and that they'd stay open later!  We've danced many a night away at this fun little club!

yJwrw4lQUmpJ_rMyvmg8bQ.text: We always make it a point to visit this bar when we come to Vegas. Amazing bartenders, amazing atmosphere so much fun. Good music if it's a band playing or a dj. Our bartender poured 12 shots at one time all different colors! It was freaking awesome!

ZpgH95mGCK1A71bFfFErmw.text: Was there tipping from drink one and the "bartender" who spilled more drinks than he poured, ignored us. Went to outside bar and got a drink because he was too busy catering to the 4 guys at the bar. Long story short, got "Vegased" but met some Gusties, some Mavericks and some Saints from Scholastica. All in all a good night if not for the bullshit. Worth it just  for connecting with the Mn peeps.

uvh2VVPijAi9JDT2TvB2dA.text: The DJ here on Wednesday nights SUCKS!!! He has long blond hair and He is so rude!! If you request a song he won't play it and will show you a rude message on his cell phone that he'll show you!!

4z8Lh5Vl554GWks9bvk_mQ.text: This place got loud music, dancing girls and friendly bartenders. As it's on strip so be prepared to get ripped off. Beers starts at $9 and shots are awfully pricey. If it's windy and chilly in vegas skip this place.  Overall staff is friendly and you can have good time here.

hU-_gefdnZP01C0T-ObTQg.text: This place was great for a party vibe without the night club. Lots of different type of people. Good mix of music. It's was lit for a Monday at 2am. Free shots. Will definitely be coming back when I'm in Vegas.

H_MpRJO8f2cx_WRNRTriFg.text: It's a Thursday afternoon and it's dead.    No band.  No bar shows.   Nothing.  Disapointing

e13FPPrPETRuG2JeowOqVQ.text: This is a definitely a carnaval but a whack one at that!  I'm not really sure how much I payed for 1 Coors Light but I'm sure it was over $10 because I gave the dude a $10 thinking I'd be fine for a drink and have some change but he kinda got pissed off and wanted more $$ so I gave him another dollar just because I was over dealing with this whack situation of getting ripped off for a crappy domestic beer the bartender shakes his head and walks away alright whatever this place is whack.  The vibe just wasn't good here music wise staff wise and all around make sure you skip this because there's a million other places directly on the strip that have good times written all over them.  On the plus side admission was free but that still isn't worth coming here on with the walkabout.

3t_f7A5TSsu8WUA8q0_AcQ.text: Fun Bar, especially when cover band, Mr. & Mrs. Smith are playing.  They get that place rocking! Great energy & people watching.

IL3RNVuFCtIfuFDWFO9fAg.text: If you're not really up for going to a club but you want to hear good music as well as possibly a live band before midnight this is the place

O6rrOJYYq8PWpAIr3Zw9qg.text: Had a super fantastic afternoon of delicious drinks and gambling here. All of the staff was very friendly and contributed to a atmosphere of good vibes. Special shoutout to our waitress whose name I believe is Nikki S! She kept our drinks flowing and the party going!

D-kBeMIrdiEcItiycjK8pw.text: Believe it or not being in Las Vegas for over a decade I've only been to this place one time only because it's very touristy it is outdoors and the bartenders to play with the bottles it's supposed to be fun it's not a bad place it's just very very touristy to go to so I only visited there once it was my friend Jeff who actually was a tourist that got very excited at the thought of this place because he found out that this was the only place on the Las Vegas strip that did beer flipping  Anyway when we got there there's a bunch of little shops around and we bought a few things and had some drinks and there was a girl singing karaoke that night and the girl sounded so could I couldn't believe it  So yes I was pleasantly surprised but seems like a lot of tourists do like their experiences at this place so I'm not going to dog it at all my experience was actually quite nice

miD-GDEfA9yPBD9-NZGVbQ.text: We stopped here as a friend had previously enjoyed this place.  It's causal and nice.  The service was ok.  Drinks were almost too strong to drink.  Music was good- first with Mr $ Mrs. Smith and then some DJ, volume was perfect, not too loud where we were.  I would recommend this place.

HAPC0frwRvoQxVNWdswnZw.text: Best bar in Las Vegas, the bartenders (shout out to Ruggs, Jamie, Rob (Awesome), Flippy and Adam) and the bands are fantastic.  My only reason for dropping this to a 4 star review is due to my concern with the recent change to fewer bands.  I was there on a Wednesday night recently and they had some Karaoke thing happening.  I also heard they were greatly reducing the Droids and the Whip-It's days and stage time.  If that is True this is a huge mistake.  This place is crazy busy and fun when bands are playing and much slower when not.  I know change is a constant in Vegas but people are always looking for live music on the strip and this place has been the best option for years.  If management from Harrah's is listening, please keep the live music at Carnaval Court, especially the Droids and Whip-It's, with a shout out to the Garage Boys as well!!  Carnaval Court is so many people's go to place on the strip due to the bartenders and bands, please keep both going strong!!

th1QON_3gXgyKNoDMw-NOg.text: Carnaval was a good time I was not expecting!  It was located right next to our hotel room and we ended up here our first night kind of by chance.  They check IDs at the door but there's no cover and there's no outside food/drink allowed. (Had to say goodbye to my Fat Tuesday but it was worth it!)  We missed the live band the first night. By the time we got there only the DJ was playing but the music was awesome. There was a good mix of old school and mainstream music as well as a variety of genres.  Dancing here was a lot of fun and it was just a chill vibe. We left pretty late and it was still going on.  Definitely going to be a regular spot from here on out.

aUsvgFUn2qFTJsCbWwxiIA.text: The band that was playing was great and the bartenders were awesome but the waitresses, oh man the waitresses. Next time you hire another waitress make sure they don't have an attitude please. We went for my husbands birthday and was having a great time till they charged us twice for the same thing then everything went south. The waitress we had from the beginning was rude and not that much fun to have around. She ended up disappearing and never coming back so we asked another waitress that was walking around for a couple drinks. She was nice at first went got our drinks came back with the check we paid and then she left.      Finally the other waitress comes back and dropped off the same check my husband didn't notice at first and I came and told him no your mom just paid that for us don't pay again. Well that didn't sit well with the waitress, she flipped out on my mother in law and then came and flipped out on my husband and said "pay the tab get out of here, security is coming." When I went to politely tell her about the check she turned flipped me off and walked away, then came back with security who wouldn't even talk to me.      I told them let me just get our friends and we are gone. As we were leaving I went to walk back to our table to grab my beer and that same waitress came right up and took it away I told her hey I'm still drinking that but she continued to ignore me and walk away. At this point my patience was running thin so I got out of there and now will never come back. Me, my friends, and family were treated so bad for no reason and we spent good money there, were we wrong for not wanting to be charged double?

chpN29n2UAmM459xOVU2Dg.text: I could give this place a million stars if I could. This bar made my trip to Vegas so much better! Jamie was so interactive and amazing and this place is so much fun. The band garage boys was playing and they were amazing as well. If you're in Las Vegas do not hesitate to stop by here! Thank you Jamie for all of your efforts to make sure we had a good time.

RoVt4Ux1TyJp4laoiWKYag.text: Good place to go to when you don't want to pay hella to get into a club. More laid back and still fun!

fjVcbKHcuL9jK1KkYelKzQ.text: Atmosphere The place was pretty fun, it's alive, interactive crowd, the people are just bringing in the good vibes, the music is decent.  Bartenders It's a hit or miss, some of the them are cool, good and can make a Hell of a drink, others are rude, don't show the flare and don't even notice that you're there unless you're flashing money around.  Price It comes with the bartender, if you got a great drink that was made well, the pricing will be awesome, if you got a drink that wasn't up to your standards, it'll feel like you're paying too much.  Overall It's a place to go to a little later in the night when you're having a good time with friends (also when you're a tad bit drunk), it's a place to enjoy a quick dance, get an average drink, and just keep the night going.

AhdADZhLNCI0NG_wQGywfw.text: This place is AWESOME. Definitely rather spend my time and money at Carnaval rather than going to a Club. The service is always great and the bartenders are very entertaining putting their aerial drink shows while preparing your drink.   Music is great and the patrons are a hoot. I always meet fun crazy drunk people from all over the world!   Definitely a must to go to this place!

QUO-ME4_VM7MBrnw0JNw6A.text: Had a great time with my hubby on a Friday night. Our bartender was friendly, funny, attentive and could do tricks with bottles and pouring drinks! Music is old like pop 90's and also good people watching.

cySZEnKTOPopzscjKYOnXA.text: Stumbled across this gem first day in town watching football... ended up coming back in Sunday and back again today.... great energy with a wide variety of all of my 80's faves!  At the carnival court by harrahs complete with flare bartenders and outdoor blackjack! My new go to during the day when I'm in Vegas! A must see for the live band enthusiast who loves a great show with a humor and real life Vegas experiences with an awesome band!

4bmxitlvWUmsXzTs20hIUQ.text: This place is always a popping good time. Located just outside of Harrah's and tucked in the back, is this outdoor dance spot. The bartenders do their tricks to entertain the alcohol-seeking crowd. The music is fantastic, with a live band or DJ. Perfect for hitting the dance floors. Plenty of seating available, and no cover charge! We had a terrific time here on a Saturday night.

pqIH8WVNJ-G0Z8Lsw-V2-g.text: This place is super fun, its in an outside tent with a huge circular bar and a stage on the back part of the tent.  Its right on the strip but a little hidden between Harah's and Imperial Palace.  During the day there is no cover charge but at night they have a band playing so it varies from $5-$15.  There flare bartenders are super entertaining,  i really enjoying all the tricks they did with the bottles and cups.  Drinks are decently priced for the Vegas environment but it will be definitely cheaper to go here than others expensive vegas clubs.  Parking is alittle hard to find but you can just find parking in any of the neighboring casinos or take a taxi.
