K2xSOtonc0oqMXi5mrA8WQ.text: Went to Vegas last month on my Annual Girls Trip and wanted to go to a bar/club that was fun and had great music but wasnt so packed you cant move on th dance floor or was filled with girls in super tight short skirts walking around like baby deers in their ridiculously high shoes... so we thought lets try Carnaval... now this is my type of Bar! We got there about 8 before they charged a cover and got a table close to the bar.. they have a DJ and a cover band that plays all kinds of great dance music... they even have good looking GoGo dancers.. its so nice how its open so your not dying of heat or feeling like sardines... the bartenders do their flare and that is fun to watch... if you tip well the bartenders take good care of you!! dont be cheap people tip your bartenders well!!! I will definitely go back here again... fun fun fun... :)

VYFSFhdQINtqv7IdkRMSuQ.text: Carnaval Court has become one of our staples in Vegas for daytime entertainment. No question it's alcoholic haze induces a circus like atmosphere. The bartenders are simply amazing with their various bar tricks and the masterful display of bottle work.  Not to be shown up are the equally entertaining people who frequent this place. More often than not on the further end of inebriation scale contributing to prove the anything goes Vegas party scene isn't all about bottle service and trendy clubs.  Arrive around 1:30pm for the live music and always be sure to ask for Jaimie the bartender.  He is a trip and the grand elder at Carnaval Court.

SZqYMNq-1bvt4bDx0j05XA.text: A really fun bar at Harrah's on the Las Vegas Strip.  Everyday this place will have several live bands and DJ's throughout the day and into the late night hours.  If you have the itch to play blackjack, Carnaval Court also has blackjack tables!  The only reason I gave 4 stars is sometimes it can take forever to get a drink if the place is busy.  My words of advice, double up on your drinks when you order, or go to the bar by the main entrance to get your drinks.

uCxWX7QBGIFJP4-FtiWxfA.text: Great open court with awesome live music. We sat down for 30 minutes before a waitress stopped at our table. I asked to see a drink/grill menu. She looked at me like I was crazy and told me the don't sell food. Ok, so please remove "& grill" from your name. The "free shots" they give away taste like Hi-C from McDonalds. I'm only giving three stars because their live band was amazing!

iCVEvvRM4IE1w0u64hKbTQ.text: Best time dancing. Band was great! Cheaper drinks than most places on the strip! Great place if you want to dance and have a blast!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had a blast! Dancing the night away!

-zlGYfrgKEz3XWCxETimhw.text: I have been here twice now. Once was a holiday weekend night and it was slamming, but still got seats at the bar.  The second time was was during the afternoon and they still had live entertainment!    This place simply rocks!  The bartenders entertain you with flair, the music is always good, and they usually have some sort of drink special/promotion going on.    I will be sure to stop by every time I'm in Vegas!

ryUqgVWT6hgcmIL1jBK0gg.text: This place sucks...especially the douchey staff.  Do yourself a favor and skip this place!

j6ztGPb-wgHXKm3l6JMAfA.text: We were walking the strip when we heard all this whistle blowing and crowd cheering. We followed the noise and ended at the Carnaval Court. It was a circular bar tucked in the middle of no where. What I liked most about it was that it was an outdoor bar!  We were there for about half an hour and it was so much fun! Every hour or so, the bartenders would start blowing their whistles and they would entertain their guests with flair bartending. They also offered free shots, but in order to get one, you have to succumb to whatever madness they think of. One girl from our group was asked to lean her head back onto the bar, kind of like when you're doing the limbo. She was blind folded with a wet towel, ice was placed into her cleavage, and a stream of vodka was poured into her mouth. It was so funny!  The drinks are cheap here and the shots are huge! I definitely recommend!

TWyKg5q5DE55lkOI80H3fQ.text: My favorite dance place in Vegas.  No cover, awesome bartenders (w/ fire shows!), great dance/party music (but still a big variety of music), and it's outside, but covered.  It's so much fun.  I've been here each time I've been to Vegas & will continue to frequent in the future.  The only con that I have is that I really wish the bartenders would give it a rest w/ the whistles.  It's really loud & can get really annoying.  If it weren't for the whistles, I'd give it 5 stars.

H7YnbtLtowHme4Q_XYohtg.text: 3.5 STARS due to the fact I came during the day and there was a concert going on at the same time.  I got in here for free courtesy of the Yelp Spring Break guide, although there's no cover here during the day...maybe later in the night, there may be.  The band playing was fronted by a lady who did a few songs decent until she got to Journey's "Don't Start Believing."  Gulp...I switched off after that...who can do that song justice besides the original Steve Perry?  Anyways, I got a drink and sat down to chill and watch the show while the show at the Carnaval bar area was in full effect.  The whistles, the wildness, the flair moves made this area very exciting and entertaining to watch up close and afar.  I can imagine that at night, this place must be even more jumping.  The whistles were a bit irritating because it did interfere with the concert performers but I guess that can't be helped, right?  Props though for them playing "Bad Girl" by Donna Summer in honor of her recent passing.  Will likely come back here if my group decides on it but no way am I sitting at the bar to have hard alcohol poured down my throat blindfolded!

v7ml83_RojRqqLfRSJvh5Q.text: its "Carnaval Court Bar & Grill" so you can have food there (just dont expect high quality... but then again who would from bar food, right?) just your average salad, burguer, sandwich, nachos, etc The drinks on the other hand are good, average price $8, you can either sit at the bar and watch your bartender prepare your drink while he juggles bottles sings and dance or have a sit at one of the tables and just order from your waiter... the bands that play there are really good also, and you can dance all night long, usually there is 2 bands per night, one plays from 1-6, the other one from 8-1and then its time for the DJthat goes at it until like 2 or 3 am (depends on the day it is) (CC is open every day since noon)... Tips:  -get there before the cover starts (I think its like 830) -park in Harrahs  - Tip good from the start -Make requests at the band, have a great time!

Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q88Wmbo3Q1edqN71GLKdTw.text: This is hands-down my favorite bar to visit and hang out in while I'm in Vegas.  No doubt about it.  The crowd is always a good mix of talent, craziness, and folks just looking for a place to have a good time and enjoy themselves.  While the bar itself is covered by a round roof, the outdoors openness of the place is one of the things that makes it attractive.  They have their own outdoor stage and typically they have good bands of all sorts playing.  Any time I have ever been there I have not seen a bad band playing, at least not yet.  The bartenders are some of if not the best.  Known for their bottle tossing and general serving tricks and antics, they are what really draw the crowd here.  I have seen some of the craziest tricks done behind a bar here; and you can see it all any time you go to this place.  Of course, the guys really like to perform for the women, so you stand a better chance of seeing something wild if you are a woman; and you may even be served a little faster because of it too.  As a guy, it's really the only drawback to the place.  Of course, the service overall is really good at the bar and you will not be disappointed watching (the bartenders or the women) while you wait.   I have had a good time every time I have been to this bar whether I'm people watching or enjoying the tricks behind the bar.  With a group of your friends, the place is even better.  Anytime you visit Vegas, make it a point to visit Carnaval Court.  I do.

R8F02NKdP0HrHaCS5H4Zmw.text: Holy moly, this place is serious about making their drinks strong. For about $30, you can get a yard of cocktail with at least 8 shots in there, sounds pretty worth it to me! When I was lining up for mine, I saw the people in front of us ordered jager bomb, and the bartender poured almost 1/3 of a bottle of jager into that yard vessel. That's about 8 shots there! Then they poured about 3 cans of redbull in there.The redbull vodka my friends and I got was mighty strong and definitely got me real buzzed and not wanting redbull vodka ever again.   The atmosphere was great here also. You can sit or stand. There's loud music, dancers and great crowd who shake it like they mean it--definitely like a real carnival that's located on the strip.

1WIMWMR04DOVL1EpTrV1Vw.text: I loved this bar. My cousin and I would hit up other bars on the strip but somehow we always ended up back here. The music is a good mix of early 2000's to today. The bartenders do crazy tricks (like juggling fire bottles). Also they give out free shots!!  If your in the area I would highly recommend checking it out!

VdMxwpmW45q6hPhTpfd1wA.text: This is horrible to day but this is probably the only part of Harrahs thats actually cool. They usually always have live music which is nice because its different...you can dance...drink...just mingle. Plus now with the Linq being so close to it you can just bar hop or just have easy access to the linq from here. Ass for Harrahs i already left a review about what i thought if that place. Hopefully they will start changing things.

mX1eDroRp9gxHG3jWrRH5w.text: Loved the Garage band as well as the Dj so much that i was drawn to spend my night in this bar twice in my 4 nights stay in Vegas. Just outside the Harrah's, the place is cool with awesome crowd. Drinks were reasonably priced with no cover charge :) The garage band is just awesome!!

Dwz0A1YkaQcI5QxQvHosQQ.text: Nestled in the shadow of Harrah's blandness and the Imperial Palace's crappiness is where you'll find this kick-ass circus tent of debauchery.    The talents of the bartenders are depicted well in the other reviews -- and these guys can even make pouring my Jack & Coke interesting.  The bands are always fun -- usually playing classic rock, 70s disco, hair band, and recent sugar-pop stuff, and I want to be Cook E Jar when I grow up.  The combination of all of the above leads to a great vibe.  Downside?  Long way to the bathroom in Harrah's.  Occasional reverse-chugging.

VlIWvNy3Db0awlbsfaDfng.text: Awesome bar - the Whip Its are an absolute MUST SEE!  Fantastic cover band with raunchy banter.

uBgLguFNlpoBzh5naRCe_w.text: Party time!!!  Came here with my buddies for some pre drinks last Friday afternoon.  The court was off the hook with good tunes and lots of chicks, plus bartenders were fairly entertaining as well.  Make sure to get there by 5, since the bands usually start playing around then, then dies off by 8, since everyone gets ready to hit the clubs.  Be warned: the drinks are cheap and add up fast.  I'll definitely return when I come back for Labor Day weekend...

v3-W8vCVOD2wDISrq71T6A.text: Stop the presses.  Skip other nightclubs.  No (or super low) cover charge? No line? No snootiness? No exclusiveness? Essentially no uptight dress code? No police-like bouncers? No male/female ratio nonsense? Open all day and all night? Fun, crazy bartenders? Outdoors? Temperature-controlled even though it's outdoors? Constant dancing? Convenient location? A party-like atmosphere? Great music? Gaming opportunities? Down-to-earth crowd? Super fun people and staff? Excellent people-watching ops? Nice, affordable drinks? Spaciousness to move yet lots of people? FREE seats? This establishment shows that 99% of the other clubs are not worth the effort it takes to be there.

9GMnWSU0gtW3XLQIhWoYEw.text: This is my favorite bar in the world. Full of vegas locals it seems. The band gets people dancing and when u want to take a break from the dance floor, sit on the bar and be amazed at how well those bartenders handle the drinks. Never have to worry about long lines, and through the roof cover charges. Oh and pretentious vegas people.

0UpcYlnMwzcax6ZIAAIXUA.text: This is what it would be like if you were living at home with your parents and they left town. Whistles, a live band, and crazy people tossing drinks all over the place. I would say you have to show up here with a slight buzz already. The music and chaos can be a bit much.   They actually had a live band going which was unexpected. I think they were called the crashers or something like that. You could tweet them your request and they would hook it up. They had about 10 security guys walking around though. That part was a bit weird. You will definitely get a huge mixed group of folks here. All age and professional ranges. Its was a fun time.

_f8rNTDLSdm9PGM2p2beGQ.text: We go to Vegas once a month and always head to Carnival Court during the day time to see Flippy, Charlie, and Awesome! Great drinks, good times, and the best staff on the strip.

MhRxUA_GO8_cFpQjzv7Q0A.text: Okay so I'm the first to yelp and add this business?!?! Super surprised. Because this place has been here for awhile., and it super rocks! There is outdoor dancing with tons of various cover bands....that are really good.....playing your favorite songs (current ones). On a loud fun stage, while you order drinks from the bar, with acrobatic bartenders! Yay. If that's not enough, the give free shots constantly, and you can dance in the front of the stage, for free, fun and not paying any fees just to have an excellent time. It's an ABSOLUTE go to for my hubby and I. No joke, we love you it here. This place is worth it and more. And dead center in middle of strip, what else do u want. You can trust me, I know what I speaketh. Lol.

Jqgt7F_7ZKQT5KR6tkHJmQ.text: 4 stars for being exactly what it's supposed to be...a casual, no frills, fun bar with lively and fun staff, a good cover band and fun and cheesy DJ...I have been coming to this place for several years and it never dissapoints...when I have an urge to just hang out with friends, meet fun people, listen to fun sing along music that I can also dance to and not worry about gettin on a VIP list, buying bottle service, or having to be around people pretending to be what they are not....this is the place I always think of when in Vegas and wish I had one at home too...lots of locals from the service industry were here when we were here this past tuesday and they seemed to be a very friendly and happy bunch...I will always come back here and reccomend to like minded friends. Oh and they also have flair bartenders that are super talented and friendly!

0NKBbqdJti1mUu-dxXgLRw.text: It was a cool hang out spot if your on the strip, live music, the bartenders will throw drinks down your throat...for a fee.  Hahah, I did get a video of some chick being a little crazy.  I posted it on you tube.   check out carniaval court. It's short, but to the point.

wE-9pztFpeBXjpZO1msQAA.text: If you're looking for a super fun spot in Vegas and you don't feel like getting dressed up for a club, this is the perfect place! It's outdoors and very spacious so you're aren't packed in like sardines. The place consists of a circular bar and a dance floor. They play pretty good music and the bartenders are not your average bartenders. They do all sorts of crazy tricks and really make drink mixing fun! They also come around and give free shots--and literally pour it down your throat. As for the other drinks, they go for around $10/shot/glass. It's a really lively atmosphere so I highly recommend going. The night I went, they had a $10 cover charge which was totally worth it.

8QqYUJd-GHo8spx6FtYC9g.text: Came here on a Thursday night/morning around 1 am looking for a place to enjoy my finance's 21st birthday. From the very entrance me and my group of 3 were greeted very well from the bouncer. The bartenders put on quite a show to say the least and the drinks were much better than expected. Thursday night nothing to do? Definitely give this spot a try

_LSK7_hS_G-GBS0zuxZE7g.text: This place was boring and the drinks were expensive! 13 bucks for a drink in a plastic cup, cm on at least make it glass! Two drinks 26 bucks place tips that's 30 bucks already on one drink for a couple. Music was alright, pretty dead. A couple had to be taken out with security within the first 15 min we were there. I thought It would be cheaper for drinks , I mean it's harrahs not that Frick in venetian!

tvuTYiDHupVVFVHpeTfrKA.text: Great outdoor Bar, live music with a great selection, the bartenders are very talented & fun to watch with their flair...we usually stop here every trip to Vegas. Drinks are strong, I think that's the case everywhere in that town. Fun mix of people there. Add this to your list of places to check out your next trip.

b_BLNM_7Szn9EOD3Z3avKA.text: Howdy Tourist :) You have been warned!  I have been here a couple of times over the years and find it overrated from a locals perspective. I guess I am just used to all of the locals spots and the great Happy Hour deals and other entertainment spots our town has to offer.   I must have visited on the wrong nights, not a whole lot of flair action going on?   I remember one time when I was feeling bad when a date paid $32 bucks not including tip for two long island drinks in an 8oz cup full of ice. Bad Bad Bad. Rip off city! I never want to go here on purpose, I am always dragged here by friends and such, ugh.   If you like beer then you can fare better, purchase the plastic pitchers of beer.  It is more about the surroundings and experience then it is the drinking and getting drunk, because that won't happen.  The drinks are weak, very weak in my opinion. I could have made a packet of kool-aid at home.  Don't waste your time going here in the day time, it is just hot since it is an outdoor bar and it is boring.  This review is more of a piece of advice for the tourists and visitors of Las Vegas who I am sure will run into Carnaval Court at some point. If you want a good time here, make sure you withdraw your life's savings in order to obtain your goal of getting a buzz!   The service from the bartender's is hit and miss really depending on who is on shift during your visit. A few of them are nice and attentive, a couple of them are just plain cocky and appear to be more focused on selecting who they will be getting their freak on with that night.   Remember folks...what happens in Vegas shows up on your test results.   Have a nice day :)

czi05dnnTB7ozn7U7yGLmA.text: It's practically a frat party!! All I gotta say is this place is pure mayhem..it's definitley a step away from typical vegas nightlife, but its a crazy good time at the carnival.  It's like a jungle in here. You got some beautiful looking creatures, some not so good looking ones, and ones that are just horrendous. However everybody is there to get wasted.   The whole setup is outside, and it's underneath a tent. It was very cracking on the summer night that I went since the weather was perfect. The bar was on the upper level, and it's huge so you won't have a problem getting a drink. The only annoying thing is that the bartenders attempt too much flair and sometimes you don't want to watch and you just want your drink! There's also plenty of seating as well.  If you like to dance, drink, and party hard this is your place to be! I don't think I ever danced with so many crazy white girls EVER. best part on top of that, was that I didn't have to pay cover as well!

vTugUMGXb-0QBL7R3-NAIw.text: Flippy is awesome. Jeremy gave me a boner. Charles is the cats pajamas. Jamie is the bees knees. Rob is very entertaining with his sexy bald head. As you can tell I frequent here a lot during the day time. Never a dull moment. The only downside of this place is its not open 24/7.

q6XxTTDxvPx-rY2Bs7SMzQ.text: I love this place and come here every time i am in vegas. My fav bartender is Steven. He's hot for one thing but also he can slay cherries on a cocktail sword clenched between his teeth! I cant even catch popcorn in my mouth. They have live music at night, its a fun atmosphere, & the people watching never disappoints.

_aFQ8pdh2fNYFpNtwQhzwQ.text: So much fun. I wish we found this place sooner on our trip and on my past trips to Vegas! The bartenders are hysterical and talented. The entertainment is always great too. It is a must see in Vegas and a great bar that is not "clubby."

el1Nk36ojWFJHMw_MrKzuA.text: I'm in Vegas at least twice a year and come here every time!  The plus is if The Garage Boys are playing!  They have bands throughout the day and they're usually very good.  Bartenders are entertaining so when the band is on break, you have the bartenders to entertain you and give you a free shot of whatever concoction they come up with.

2Isq2SIfZ9svBzFtOHn0LQ.text: i was only hear for a hot minute but what i gathered was that this place is a heck of a good time. We heard the loud music in passing and went to grab a drink, they found out it was one of my friends birthday, all the sudden whistles were blowing and bottles flying, the bartender came around front and poured a drink in her mouth.    In the background they had a fun band playing all sorts of party music.   Ill definitely go back next time im in town.

lgmHQHlevVfyiLcQO_BOsA.text: I went there to celebrate my 30th birthday with a group of friends and Family. As I was sitting down on a chair we had all of our belongings on two tables, there were 2 girls started putting our stuff on the ground and moving the tables towards them. I told them that the tables were already being used. (as we were sitting there) Her friend kept moving our purses and jackets and she starts yelling at me calling me names, spit on me, started hitting me. A huge fight breaks out, my Sister stops her other friend who is also trying to attack me and they fall to the ground. My Husband and Brother runs over to separate the fight, their thug male friends also getting in telling the girls to continue to hit us and use the weapons they supposedly had in their purses. The Carnival Court security officers throw my Husband and Brother to the ground punching them both in the ribs and shoving my brother in laws face into the ground and another used his foot to keep my Husbands head on the ground. We also got detained and said we had to be held until Metro PD got there. We all have black eyes, scratches and spit all over our faces but one of the Carnival Court security lets the thugs go and tells them to run while we are held down because the police were being called. We then tell our side of the story and the one security guard tells us that it's our fault and we asked for all this because there's no saved seats. The thugs were moving our personal belongings on the floor and taking the tables and chairs as we were using them. Metro finally shows up, we are still detained, it was very embarrassing, everyone was staring at us and security guards were laughing at us. When metro asked the security guards where the other party was so they can be questioned they told them they were let go. Metro couldn't even believe the situation. We couldn't even press charges because the security guards let them go and told them to run far because metro was being called. I tried calling management the next day and they just gave me the run around. No one ever got back to me.

6XsAz_xX_iYSPxcx0BHXYA.text: One of my top....if not my top spot in Las Vegas!  It is always a good time if you go at 12 noon or 12 midnight!  Great live music, and fun dj music as it gets later in the day.  I have made a trip here ever since I wandered in about 5 years ago, and it hasn't changed one bit!  I even recognize some of the bartenders as I return year after year.  Feels like home!  Haha wait...does that mean I have a Carnaval Court problem?  Perhaps.    Headed back for another trip next week and can't wait!  Swing by the place if you are looking for something fun and different!  You will find all types of people at that place and there is a laid back yet party atmosphere that will never disappoint!

OxGgFtw5oIUN5WFrjK5_Hw.text: The best place to get Angry Orchard on tap for 4.00 a cup! This place rocks! The live music is fantastic and has a great location just outside of Harrah's!

XEIr7C9jysEIuvYrQYycgg.text: This place was so much fun and great to people watch. The band Mr & Mrs Smith were very entertaining and the DJ in between their set was awesome. The bartenders have some serious skills and are amazing to watch. Great atmosphere. Would definitely come back and it's nice to get outside and not be stuck in casino bars!

TOytaP6EM6p7rpT2Iy5REA.text: I went to this outdoor bar both during the day and night. The bar sits in between Harrah's and The Linq. It is outdoors and the bar is a big circle. When i went during the day, they had a live band. There was quite a few people around the bar and in the table areas to the side but not many people on the dance floor. The drinks are good but pricey, but then again, so is everything in Vegas. They did give out free shots if the bartender could balance bottles and glasses on his head and walk around the bar without dropping them. The bartenders were nice and fun entertainment. At night there was a DJ and the music was really good. There was a lot of people dancing, it felt more like a club. It was free to get in as well. I had so much fun here, I definitely would visit again in the future.

EEC_DKWDGTH1K-QVHpjgJg.text: Every year we go to Carnaval court on a women's trip, this trip has been going on for 25 years and I've been roughly 8 times. This year we were all Pretty disappointed as the wait in the bar area was so outrageous we ended up going to the bar outside of the area to get our drinks. If the bar was busy this makes sense, but there was hardly any people in line and on top of tap there was at a minimum 5 bartenders.   The band was awesome as it always is and is one of the reasons we come here to party, however the DJ was terrible and many people in my group and people outside my group commented on it. There was too much changing of songs mid song. This is not a modern club and that's why we are attracted to it. Having a modern DJ takes away the charm, we left earlier than we ever have any other year. We know 3 groups of people from 3 other states who also come here on the same weekend every year and they were also disappointed.

2awRzj1kdRcE_UVZde5FPw.text: I had a great time here on Labor Day Friday...a mid-afternoon of cold beers sitting under misters (air mist machines in case there was any question) while listening to The Whip Its.  The band was fun and I've gotta say their guitarist (Dieter, I believe...) was terrific with the solos and innuendos!  The server, Stephanie, really hustled and had personality as well.   I'd go back for sure next time in town.

btHTIkZFzybaLoUBnX6YhA.text: This is my fave place to take out of town guests for dancing and drinks! It's always easy to just show up and join the fun. No expensive bottle service or lines. There are also some free shots but the bartenders use whistles a lot and I don't care for that. Otherwise love the fun bands and DJ that play here regularly. Hope Carnaval Court never goes away.

GR97tRKPaa9d-eWISRmzrA.text: Good serviceand some entertaining g music(alternates between bands and DJs, there may be a schedule for what bands are playing when).  The price is solid enough for Vegas and the service was really good.  I ended up going there twice on my vacation last week.

ib7C4NjqIsxhlknxaKY9xg.text: What a FUN time! A completely unexpected surprise, tucked away in a nook beside Harrah's.   Some locals near Planet Hollywood recommended we come here for the free cover, the dancing, the overall vibe and the free shots! Great decision.   We absolutely loved the awesome staff here - Renee the bartender was AMAZING! Super friendly, fun and high energy. The bouncers were friendly too.   HOWEVER - we had the grave displeasure of dealing with "Ruggs" the bartender. He was by far the rudest bartender I've ever met. He was high energy but short with everyone, he even verbally accosted this woman because she touched his tips - "you're stealing from me! I'm going to call the cops on you bitch!" When in reality, the woman had picked up his tip after it fell to the floor. I'm fairly certain this man was on drugs. He was acting crazy and we almost left the bar because of how uncomfortable and unwelcome he made us feel.   Had the manager not stepped in and asked him to take a break, we would have left, and never had he pleasure of meeting Renee and the rest of the crew.  I'd recommend coming here for sure - no outrageous gimmicks or covers. Very generous pours and a good time. Just avoid that bartender if you can...

The DJ was kind of eh, but the vibe of the place was still pure Vegas Fun! I ended up having three pints here and probably would have had more except last call came a calling. 3GPGvuOT4j6Bbm7arLzrvw.text: Well this was a fun place to be.  We came as a group to celebrate a birthday.  It's an outdoor area club with a stage.  So perfect for the Vegas nights, and different feel vs being stuffed in an indoor club over packed with people spilling drinks on you all night long.  The cover band here (which yes, I forgot their name) was great.  They kept the hits coming and kept us dancing.  The drinks were good, and for those who do not drink the liquid courage gave them the courage to dance.  This is totally a great spot for a large group too.    Drinks were average prices and at 2am the party was still going.  This is a fun spot mostly for a mid 30's and up since the cover band this particular day was hitting all the 90's and late early 2000's hits.   I'm sure there are different bands each week so check out the lineup before you go so you can make sure you have the type of music you want.

qicTfLAhqtXBVWFUDm9kYw.text: If you like to dance to music that is not all rap or electronica THIS IS THE PLACE.   Absolutely great dance floor. Drinks are fine, bartenders do crazy tricks when they make drinks.  You can get a "blow job" and they get up and put the drink between their legs ... all in all one of our best nights was spent dancing here!

e6ZHuWSfg5y0us6lCclK1Q.text: Carnaval Court is awesome, great bartenders and the 80s band kills it! This visit the musical entertainment got switched up and they just don't live up to the Whip Its style, crowd engagement and overall entertainment. #morewhipits

YCrUE4-4KdWHKrv81JsgGQ.text: The "live" band was straight cover lip sync trash. Just keep the DJ on.  Free fun, though at times they do charge a cover.

wkTuE4ey7vCJ9zAP060SsA.text: A great place to hang out, listen to music, people watch and not get ripped off for a drink.  Since O'Sheas closed, this has become one of the places we hang out, this is not a high end hang out place, this is somewhere to kick back and relax.  The downside is, though there are food places around the bar, you can't actually take food into the bar area, strange, but that's about it.  One great addition has been a band called The Garage Boys, they moved over from O'Sheas and now play there every other week, they play everything, from Vanilla Ice, to MotorHead to a hilarious cover of Shania Twain's "I feel like a woman"

SwxyXMv88OSFW3avfLFsVg.text: This is the place you come to when you're in Vegas and it's far too early to go anywhere else.   You can get ginormous drinks for reasonable prices (by Vegas standards of course). The crowd around the bar is such an eclectic mix of young, old, hot and not. The bartenders are known for the flair, which gets more and more entertaining the more you drink.   After fighting my hangover from the night before, we walked down to this bar and decided to drink away our sorrows. The mixture of the live DJ's, people dancing, and drinks flowing was enough to get me back in the groove.   I would not spend the entire night in LV here, in fact I don't know if I would even spend any of my evening hours drinking here... But it is definitely the spot to pre-drink and get your early party on before heading to a club or lounge.

RuSvuJSMm7NmQE-R4hbJRQ.text: Nicest Bar ever!!  I don't remember their names but the Asian looking bar tender in smaller bar to the right of the main bar. - he was so cool, High Fives and ice cold beers/Shots, etc.  And the White guy with the Faux-Hawk outside selling those GIANT booze containers - super nice.  Not like those typical "Douches" that you encounter when trying to order alcohol. Pleasant, friendly and all over good guys. 2kzVucSUmdw8_8la-rDIbw.text: Worst bar around. They will let you buy drinks but, if you want water the chubby asian bartender cusses you out and tells you leave. Definitely not a place worth your money.

1fRuysnBT5IWqqDDfodIAw.text: Many Vegas locals claim they never visit the Strip because it's too expensive and full of pesky tourists. Not me. One of my favorite places in Vegas is Carnaval Court at Harrah's.  I first walked into Carnaval Court three years ago when I first moved to Vegas, and it's now become my second home. Why? Because it's one of those bars that doesn't have that "Strip" feel even though it's smack dab in the middle of the thing.  The bartenders put on an amazing show, the drinks are strong enough to put you three times over the limit with one glass, the live band (The Crashers) seems to always be a crowd favorite, and you can always expect your shoes to be stuck to the floor by the end of the night.   It's not just any bar, though. As well as the live music, there's a free show at the bar, too, courtesy of the flair bartenders (my favorites are Duane and Rene), who juggle three bottles at a time or balance a stack on their head topped off with a little fire (really, fire). There are even go-go dancers and a hookah bar, both new introductions in the last couple of months, as well as games of blackjack being played on the patio.   Beers start at $7 for a Bud or $11 for a well drink, and there's a cover charge on weekends, even for women, but I think it's well worth it.  If drinking, dancing, gambling and seeing some great flair bar tending is your thing, come on down to Carnaval Court and see why I keep coming back.

fGtrCdn_con9DsLwhEAPHQ.text: Best bar in the Strip!! Floppy is the best bartender we have ever seen. We LOVE THIS BAR! We end up hanging for WAY longer than planned!!!

0EGz3mD4HJ_HIsB_AJeNzQ.text: What an amazing outside bar! Mig and Rob were amazing bartenders! We will be back! No lines to get in and no cover charge! I think we spent more $$$ on tipping these amazing bartenders, what a show they all put on! Great bands, DJ's and atmosphere! Drinks were reasonably priced for Vegas! This place is a must visit!

p5LXM630sqWj6Tn9HSHJbg.text: Otherwise known as the 10th Circle of Vegas Hell.  I would have given it one star, but it does cater nicely to a certain demographic, and who am I to judge?!  But unless you are of that demographic (alcoholic trailer-park-dwelling assembly-line-worker-on-vacation-from-Rustbucket, USA), you might share my low opinion of this depressing place.    Carnaval Court tries really hard to be cheerful and fun.  REALLY HARD!  But all the ear-splittingly-loud Bon Jovi covers and manically juggled cheap booze in the world can't mask the oppresively depressing nature of the bar's denizens: blue collar mooks, on perpetual Spring Break from a third-tier community college, desperate to bag whatever beat-up white trash trim they can scare up.  Bachelerotte parties celebrating some unfortunate muffin-topped truck-stop waitress's thrird marriage.  Bowling alley attendants and their factory-worker wives, gaping maws open wide and turned up like baby birds to catch the cheap drizzle of sticky booze being poured down like proletariat manna by the bartenders, who tend to get up on the bar and tease the patrons with "free shots" poured directly from unmarked bottles.  Good times!  Actually, this place would be pretty good people watching, if it weren't so ear-splittingly, soul-shatteringly LOUD!  Not only does the live cover band BLARE one played-out  classic rock party anthem after another, but the bartenders (seemingly all 500 of them) constantly blast shrilly into the metal whistles tightly clamped in their grimaces, and repeatedly bang their metal cocktail shakers onto the metal bar... OVER and OVER and OVER, in a grim, desperate attempt at merrymaking.  This place is DETERMINED TO MANUFACTURE FUN OUT OF NOISE, as if sound waves can conquer misery and squalor.  Good luck with, that, guys!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. booze takes care of all pretensions to class and decency
Photo of Carnaval Court - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mayhem and embarrassing debauchery

EiqGsYdp_S3519lLSAxnsw.text: Had such a great time here!!! Got seats at the bar and watched the bartenders preform the whole time. Warning: the drinks are strong and you will get smashed! Lol  We will def be back next time we come to Vegas :)

H8Fsa0hgM-aQ8sFiM00Htg.text: This place is a blast! Vegas can learn a lot from this business model. No cover, free shots every hour, live band half the night then DJ. Outdoor so smoke is not an issue. Attracts a laid back casual party crowd without the pretentious Vegas visitors. Have been here about 8x including a 21er. Always fun. Bouncers never in your face and just along the edges to make sure everything is ok. Usually little or no line. Flare bar tending. Drinks are normal Vegas prices. Stuck up people go somewhere else.

The bartenders are highly talented here with ability to perform complex and dangerous maneuvers.    Carnaval is a good place to stop on a bar crawl.  There's a line after a certain time though.

4rMmmmTSCaSPi74Adcb-bw.text: This is a great alternative to the club scene in Vegas. There aren't many places where you can dress casually in shorts & flip flops and still be able to dance.   We were staying at the Harrah's, but didn't get a chance to check this place out until Sunday night. We did walk past on Fri & Sat and there were more people, but Sunday still had a good crowd.   I didn't get a chance to see the flare show, but I did get an awesome shot from the bartender that was pouring shots from the top of the bar.   If your looking to party, but don't feel like dressing up this is your spot. I know they have bands early on, but after a certain time they have djs.

624iQnd1hKWUsQj99f7A7w.text: THE BARTENDER MIG IS RUDE. Me and my boyfriend went to Vegas on Saturday night, and my friend who lives there suggested that we meet her at the carnival court bar, so we did. Everything was fine until Mig cut off my boyfriend after two drinks. My boyfriend wasn't acting belligerent or rude, but I guess Mig didn't like him for some reason. Drinks are strong, and big enough for vegas, and this bar is outdoors (awesome) and feels a little old, but it's a nice change from the glitz and glam.  That said, it was a little too crowded and crazy, and we had to leave to walk down the strip after kickoff since we were being given some mean stares by some patrons trying to keep open seats for their purses. Grrr.

l6_JQGRVTxwkjNP2nShaOA.text: Oh Carnival Court.... I'm a local of 7 years now, and haven't been here in ages. Totally missed it after I've spent tons of money in high end clubs over the years.   This place has a $10 cover, drink prices are average for the strip but the scene is priceless!  Young and old, hot messes and some crazy shit I just can't explain.   They always have a live band or DJ and flare bartenders.   Good times, and good people watching, not really for the snobbish crowd, :)

R9P3k1YBoF-VtL8s8MVVKQ.text: Carnaval Court is so much fun!  This is an outdoor plaza with lots of kiosks selling just about anything you can think of, but the most important feature is the circular bar in the back area. This area has lots of seating, a huge dance floor, and a stage where either a DJ or live band can perform.   Every night of the week, there is a party going on and the bartenders keep things hyped up by performing alcohol acrobatics with the bottles as they pour drinks and every so often put on a fiery show for the audience.  If you're looking for a great party with alcohol, dancing, and lots of fun with no cover charge and is right in the middle of the action on the strip then you really need to check this place out.

34LDOc1iLYZH6snfKHwQSA.text: I've been coming here for years now and has consistently been the best outside bar in Vegas.  The free live music is the best money can buy.  Also the bartenders use alot of flare when pouring drinks. Good place to start a night of festivities.

IU5FOx0qMGBpsQSSPRJuZg.text: I love to get hammered here!!  It's an older crowd and a nice break from the ultra chic casino megaclubs.  It reminds me of my younger days partying in rosarito beach at papas n beer or senor frogs;  Back when white people were still brave enough to cross that southern border.  Oh well.    But drinks are moderately priced and you can always count on a couple cougars going bananas on the dance floor.  Great place for daydrinking.    Bartenders will blow yo' mo'fo mind!  Believe that... :)  I've never had a bad time here. ever.

uWj0kV0UKfm3UN_5sEkyig.text: When going to Vegas it is a must that a Friday/Saturday night stop to Carnaval is made...A very laid back atmosphere with the greatest bartenders to tend to your alcoholic needs.    This last visit, CInco de Mayo weekend'12, husband and I brought my little sister along and she thoroughly enjoyed herself.  She is into the glam of the more private clubs but this time around she was able to dress down and relax.  She was even tipped to tip for a tequila shot.  Sat at the bar in "Josh's" ---aka "NINJA"---section, as we always do and...as always, we were far from being disappointed.  Kudos to bartender "Rene" who made my husband feel sooo special by getting him a bar seat from the other side of the bar just to make sure he was taken care of.    Carnaval should be visited at least 1x to see for yourself.  Again, laid back atmosphere, dress down (not too down), can be loud, look for "JOSH or RENE" and just enjoy the tricks of mixology.

dyYAGTsYaasXVbMnrLo2XQ.text: Live music was great. The band was called SilverSage. The band was super engaging and fun  What captured my heart was the Talent of bartender Rob. He made drinks with so much entertainment, enthusiasm and enjoyment that every bar guest stopped doing what they were doing to watch Rob's masterpiece.   Thank you Rob! You are a Star

WSUXxKQTiPojl166CgCCqQ.text: Crazy enough, I've struggled for years to find a good bar scene during the week when in Las Vegas minus the clubs. The area has live music with a nice size dance floor. As you walk in the bar takes up most of the venue, but the music and dance floor are located up front, so you don't have to be on top of it if you want to have conversations.  Get your dancing shoes out because this has been a great spot to mingle and or relax. Take your pick.   Ambiance: B+ Drinks: C Cost: C

gLfxkbnqh0KFvQg2M5j-Zg.text: We had a blast last night! The energy there is total party and nonstop fun! If you go there, order the "Fickle Dip" it is delicious!

hxylDhVm68TXhQDAwBw2Hg.text: FAVORITE BAR IN VEGAS... PERIOD!!! Go ahead and pass by all the rest of the bars and come straight here! Bartenders are fabulous, music is fantastic and did I mention the bartenders were AWESOME!!! 12 stars! My go to whenever I come to Vegas$

Ever seen the movie Cocktail? The bartenders have some super fancy bottle work, makes having a drink even better. Decent drink prices and in a great location between Harrah's and LINQ.

jjlUJoA6rME7O5MePkgudQ.text: Carnival Court is great due to being a little bit of everything. The bands play all sorts of music. The fun crowd shows up after 10pm at which point it's crazy fun and nonstop dancing. The atmosphere here is somewhat like The Garage and the cool bars downtown. It's frequented by visitors and locals, I recommend this place.  P.S. they don't serve food here, it's strictly a fun bar with live band music and DJs in between breaks.

_UieJkRr85L13X4UV_s6nw.text: Ended up here after a bad experience at the nearby piano bar. Anthony the manager took GREAT care of us. VIP service all the way. THANK GOODNESS!!! This is a really fun venue. The bartenders have some really cool moves when they're making the drinks! The bartender actually was pouring shots into peoples mouths while blowing the whistle just like down in TJ which was awesome! There was a band that played a bunch of hits and in between their sets was a really cool DJ. It is an outside venue which is so nice. Big dance floor too. Definitely stop by and check this place out it's a really good time!

dD4c-a8RGZnJAJAxAr8H1A.text: Cool little bar/club at Harrahs Casino. Live bands. Good prices on beer buckets. Fun environment. Sometimes empty, sometimes crowded.

f8FUM6KqaZRWT6D9njZBfw.text: What a horrible experience... I came here 8 years ago and I bragged about this place telling everyone how cool it was and that I would come back. This time I was greeted by an extremely rude old fat sloppy tits white dude. He was an asshole right from the jump. Trying to be funny and rude ruining the whole energy for me and my guest. We asked him for an additional chair and he said "look around" when asked for a drink he was being sarcastic saying to order already... seriously? Lol Will take my money elsewhere... what a let down.

bunemdMr2bivA9DOP-L9ig.text: I had a bad experience with the bar at the entrance. A man with a hat back , I asked him for water it was super hot and didn't have any money on me . 9TyVgQEF4l5LNn4kV93roQ.text: It is what it is... and it's not for me! I would say I am probably not their target audience.  55 year guy here. Ho0tzrII2kbzCE4rAkaj_A.text: A fun place to stop for a few drinks with entertainment from the bands and bartenders. Lots of shots, flair bartenders, and more shots. I personally love the Fickle Dip! Highly recommend if your looking for fun evening and a break from gambling.  Also the bartenders are legit, top notch!

6Lh8QhPtbbcmgHd8mb2Jow.text: I loved this place, I went twice during my trip; awesome. Sunday night during the VGK game was insane; they said I had a good time ;)

D35IlHwDCtlrw8AQQ8Gt3Q.text: Snuggled between Harrah's and The Linq, Carnaval Court is not for the faint of heart or anyone under 21.  I have only been during the day so I can only imagine what goes on there at night. ;) No cover charge which is awesome.  You will have to use the restroom inside Harrah's. No outside food or drink. The music is loud so I always come prepared with my earplugs.  Thank goodness there are misters to help with the heat.  The bartenders are what make this place ROCK! They are friendly and so hilarious.  This place is great for people watching. Once the tunes start blasting and the drinks start flowing- the tourists start to let loose and shake their money makers on the dance floor in front of the stage for all to see.

A2mYhQJA8cWwzYjPKMTDuQ.text: Gordy was our bartender last night and he was amazing. He along with Vache & Paul made sure my friends and I had a good time, but mostly ensured our safety throughout the evening. There was a guy who was bothering us and Vache had him removed in seconds. Gordy was in tune with our how we doing thru out the night and was perceptive to cues when strangers would approach. Overall great experience they were so fun, but overall it was great knowing me and my friends were being taken care of.

pDTiF-2n2W07xXssVkZ06A.text: Has been one of my favorite places to visit never had any issues until this last time. I was with a group of friends and my BF Was not let in because he was told they do not accept his type of ID. Mind you I have been here several times before and he has always been let in. The securities answer was our rules change often. Completely disappointed. Why would a government issued ID not be accepted.

teA6jmTPQoVGBhA6S7WiLg.text: 2nd time here, its Friday night and again I'm disappointed. I thought this was renowned for the flair bartenders but not much flairing going on. Golden gate downtown deals with more customers and the flairing is, in my opinion, more frequent and far superior.

5p8VbJbMIWf-5zUth2k3rQ.text: Cool spot to hang out at, right on the strip.  Bottle service all night, along with a good cover band.  What could go wrong?  Good sized dance floor, "to drop it like it's hot".  The entire crew had a lot of fun, good laughs and lots of drinking.

aDM0BFUgMgrj_eOGeAP1VQ.text: This place was so much fun, live the band it plays 80's early 90's music. Even got to get. My buggy on. The drinks are very worth ordering, they put lots of liquor really strong. Will be back next time. Had a great time dancing and they even poor shot from bar into mouth! Great time

kq3vVkMGX1KgyecpfBQU6A.text: This bar was so much fun!! If you like no cover, 80/90s music, this is the place for you!  We had a great time having a few drinks and dancing to live music.   The band covered great 90s songs and it was a blast all around.

IBbL1tIBwozYUV0RFDIy3g.text: The bartenders are amazing!  Such a fun place! The drinks are great and there is music mostly all day and night- either DJ or Live.  Me and my sister came for a fashion convention and this was our go to spot!  Will definitely be our spot each time we come back!

unfUTkon4XGN0klXTq06AA.text: Good DJs and live music!  And no cover!!  What happened to all the live music lounges??  This place has good dance music and if you just want to dance go here.

497DxJNfYf9iC0dhFdF6zw.text: my favorite bar in vegas!!! always talented fun bartendars and live music!!! offers blackjack! Friendly crowd, everyone on the same party level!

37Ku4Zoe0zs8yPHJYcl0Pw.text: Best part was live music. I wish they had more variety of beers on tap.

ZeMlUDGyex_FrCWvVliw9A.text: Me and my friends just came here for a short while walking the strip during the day. I was hoping there would be a lot of people, but it was kind of empty. Maybe it gets more crowded at night.  Anyways, me and my friends were watching the live band, in which the singer asked my boyfriend to be spanked, which he accepted, haha. Also I treated my friend to a drink for his birthday ($11, pricey!) but it was made really good... I wish I knew the name of it. Anyways after telling the bartender it was my friend's birthday he gave him a crazy elevated shot.... I videotaped that moment for his future wife and employers.  Then we continued on walking the strip...

dcfVhhwQehQu7DFRvoCK6g.text: Stopped by here one night during our stay and my BF just had to get one of those huge drinks you see everyone walking around with.  What made it even better was that it wasn't blended!  Our bartender (at the outside area bar) was super friendly and very talented in the flair department!  He talked story with us while mixing our drink - and it was good!  My BF said that it was 100oz, but I'm not sure...it seemed like it!  A fun tourist spot to check out and maybe bring back a big-ass souvenir, if you can pack it!!

upxsdqDm_vYLvu1jU9Tt3g.text: Great concept. An outdoor bar in the middle of the desert on a hot night. The beer list is far from amazing, but the bartenders definitely have some flair. With a decent tip, they are also attentive. If they had just one microbrew, I'd give it an extra star.  The music was pretty much pop/dance style stuff, so if that's your thing, not too bad. If you're looking for some hard rock, probably not going to find it.  I had a good enough time as it was a chance to wind down with the wedding party after a busy day.  For a nice enough place, with decent music and some beer, give this place a try.

KF_xYwzL3ttzxmZYO8ICZg.text: Bartenders are awesome, music is always good, drinks are stiff and affordable. During the day it's a great place to hangout and party .. Very casual

4HK2ld9qL8CCnr22UUU7BQ.text: My favorite bar in Vegas. Unassuming, good bartenders, fun place.  Drinks are pretty expensive, but they have 2-3 shots in them, so it evens out. Nice to sit outside too

cItiKfGfeQRvJLikCeFxxw.text: Best place in Vegas. Best bands and bartenders.  Highly recommended you see the flair bartenders, they always bring a show and good time with you drink.

KjIHOKXe2WG-YsGwKsuSQw.text: I've been coming here for about 10 years and it has changed so much. It used to be my favorite local spot to hang out. Live band and outdoors are always attractions when you want to chill and have a few drinks. But the bands have changed and now they have a dj that plays techno music. The atmosphere is so different that it draws a different crowd now. Used to enjoy interacting with people, but it seems like most of the people there are douches! Not sure if I will be back with the wife!

kVSSD1eaBLqlk74A7Dplug.text: PROS: Carnival Court is definitely FUN, not only to watch the flair bartenders, but the live entertainment is great, huge dance floor, blackjack tables, elevated circular bar, and great to people watch/meet all kinds of people from everywhere. Drinks I feel are on the pricey side, but definitely worth the entertainment from bartenders, live entertainment and again, mix of people that roll in/out of that place. Best of all, C.Court is outside!  So, you can get your drink on, gamble on and dance on at this one stop shop!  CONS:  For a place that NEVER used to charge, they've gone to charging men and NOW women after 9PM. There is nothing different about this place, so why the cover charge?  They also put in cheap leather looking booth seating with a cheesy sign for VIP/Bottle service. There is nothing VIP about this place other than just being able to have a designated place to sit. Not worth the extra money, don't fall for that bs!  Carnival Court should NOT charge to get in. This is not a club. All walks of life go into this place and to start projecting C.Court as a club is really comical.

viOHa0wkhwbYbnrwWHAxFQ.text: Great place to hear live music outside and get drinks that are a little cheaper than normal Vegas prices. I have gone here a couple of times on the weekend days (haven't checked it out at night) and with the right crowd it can be fun. It's a laid back atmosphere, nothing pretentious and there are some gambling tables. Food is not served there so it's really a big outdoors bar. Have some drinks and dance away!

-c7yb6B-XsRRLTyqKpNdyQ.text: Favorite free place in this city...the music is ALWAYS great, playing top 20 dance mixes.  It's loud and at night even gets a good crowd around the stage.  The bartenders are fun and if you tip them well they'll hook you up.  The place is in a tent outdoors right on the strip.  You can valet at Harah's next door if you have a car.  It's free to get in but there is a bouncer checking ID's.  The drinks are a little expensive but like I said make it worth it and tip better.  I'm pretty sure a DJ plays all day but I've only seen it crowded at night.  It's a fun place to stop for a drink while walking the strip no matter what time it is.  My only dilemma with this place is why not refill the Yards?  It's a tough job carrying those things around.
